item.title: New Ghost in the Shell Scheduled for July 2026! With Music by Taisei Iwasaki, Ryo Konishi and Yuki Kanesaka!
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • Ghost in the Shell is a series revered by fans worldwide, and continues to leave an impact on creators across borders and generations. In conjunction with the opening of the first-ever Ghost in the Shell exhibition â€œGhost and the Shellâ€, currently being held at NODE Tokyo, it was announced that the latest TV anime production of Ghost in the Shell will be airing in Japan starting July 2026. The very first key visual and promotional video was released as well.
  • The first key visual and original artwork from the series is currently on display at the â€œGhost and the Shellâ€ exhibition.
  • The musical producers for the new series have also been announced! The musical director is Taisei Iwasaki, known for composing the score for Ryuu to Sobakasu Hime (Belle), which won a Japan Academy Award for â€œBest Musicâ€. In addition, Ryo Konishi, who served as the music director the Osaka World Expo and produces for artists such as Chara+YUKI, Mrs. Green Apple, TOMOO and more, will be collaborating with U.S.-based composer Yuki Kanesaka, who produced the music for TV anime Dr. Stone.
  • Updates will be posted to the new Ghost in the Shell website and official social media accounts.
    • https://youtu.be/xl8bNn3BRRM Ghost in the Shell Exhibition â€œGhost and the Shellâ€ tokyonode.jp/sp/exhibition-ghostintheshell

    About Taisei Iwasaki

    Award-winning musician whoâ€™s known for his work on Ryuu to Sobakasu Hime, Hateshinaki Scarlet, Giant God Warrior Appears in Tokyo, TV anime Kekkai Sensen, Spriggan, Marriage Toxin, and more. Moteki and Ryuu to Sobakasu Hime won the 35th and 45th Japan Academy Awards for â€œBest Musicâ€ respectively, while Ryuu to Sobakasu Hime went on to win the 36th Japan Golden Disc Award for â€œBest Soundtrack of the Yearâ€.

    Comment from Taisei Iwasaki

    â€œIn middle school, I came across a magazine with an illustration of Motoko Kusanagi inside. That was the moment when I discovered Ghost in the Shell. Its unique touch and color set it apart from other works. Even the authorâ€™s name, Masamune Shirow, captivated me. I was stunned. Iâ€™ve since encountered the series in various forms. Now, I am truly honored to be a part of this project and its long history. The concept I envisioned for this project is â€œSound Public Security Sector 9â€. With the help of my talented friends, I will strive to make this long-awaited work even better. May we all come together soon.

    About Ryo Konishi

    Born July 25, 1988 in Tokyo. Musical composer, arranger, and performer on saxophone, flute, clarinet, synthesizer, and vocoder. He served as the musical director for the opening ceremony of the Osaka World Expo, and has produced for numerous theatre productions, drama productions, and artists including Chara+YUKI, Mrs. Green Apple, TOMOO and more. His style as a performer involves mastering and playing multiple instruments, making him a valuable multi-instrumentalist in multiple settings including Chara and Millenium Parade led by Daiki Tsuneta. Heâ€™s participated in numerous festivals both domestically and internationally, including NHKâ€™s â€œKohaku Uta Gassenâ€, Fuji Rock Festival, and Summer Sonic.

    Comment from Ryo Konishi

    â€œI first watched Innocence when I was in junior high school. Ever since my heart was stolen by its intense charm, Iâ€™ve pursued everything related to Ghost in the Shell. Its influence is deeply ingrained into my own work and philosophy. At first, I couldnâ€™t believe that I was entrusted with creating music for this work, but I wanted to embrace this precious world. With that feeling in my heart, I took on this project with my entire body and soul. Follow the whispers of my ghost!â€

    About Yuki Kanesaka

    A music creator and composer based in Boston, creating music daily across the U.S. and Europe. In recent years, heâ€™s been working as an assistant professor at Berklee College of Music, discovering music and developing technology, while also developing products for companies like Sony and AlphaThetha/Pioneer. He enjoys working and can play around 74 instruments. Recent works: - Shiryu Sejima (artist) - Dr. Stone/Jujutsu Kaisen/Snowball Earth (anime music) - olkswagen/Kyupi/Meiji/Yonex (commercial music) - Jojoâ€™s Bizarre Adventure/Sonic Racing (game music)

    Comment from Yuki Kanesaka

    â€œI began with a single utterance: â€œGhost in the Shell? Never heard of it!â€, before immediately ordering every English and Japanese version I could get on Amazon. As I dove into composing at my private studio in Boston, a vast number of motifs began preparing for their musical journey. To Nashville, where my allies wait, for additional recordings. To a Shanghai hotel, for tailoring. Finally, the motifsâ€™ journey comes to an end in Tokyo, transforming from a phenomenon called â€œa passageâ€ into a message called â€œa suiteâ€. A journey without hesitation, without blurring, without rewriting. These songs are like maps, etched with a trail of my thoughts and impulses. Ghost in the Shell Official Accounts Official Website: theghostintheshell-anime.jp Official X: @thegits_animeEN Official Instagram: @thegits_anime

item.title: Winners Announced for MyAnimeList x Honeyfeed Writing Contest 2025, with Publication in Japan Confirmed!
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="Illustration by Seira Minami" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • KADOKAWA CORPORATION, in partnership with qdopp Inc. and MyAnimeList Co., Ltd., co-hosted the MyAnimeList x Honeyfeed Writing Contest 2025 â€“ THE ISEKAI presented by KADOKAWA. The English-language isekai fantasy novel contest was held on Honeyfeed, a novel submission platform operated by qdopp, with the goal of discovering exceptional storytelling talent from around the world. The winning works were announced today on the contestâ€™s official webpage.
  • Out of a total of 1,240 entries, one Grand Prize winner and two Contest Winners Prize recipients were selected.
    • MyAnimeList x Honeyfeed Writing Contest 2025 â€“ THE ISEKAI presented by KADOKAWA Webpage: mhwc.myanimelist.net/202507

    Grand Prize â€œIsekaiâ€™d with my dog, I'm not the hero?!â€ by Frettiko

    An average guy named Mitsuta is reincarnated into another world along with his pet dog, Toast. However, the goddess becomes utterly smitten with the adorable Toast and grants all of the heroâ€™s bonuses to him instead. For a level 99 â€œHeroâ€ Pomeranian, defeating monsters is a walk in the park. Meanwhile, his owner Mitsuta remains stuck at level 1... Constantly dragged along by the free-spirited Toast, Mitsuta gathers a group of quirky companions and runs an odd-jobs business, gradually carving out a place for himself in this new world. At this rate, they might even end up defeating the Demon King someday? A fluffy, feel-good comedy about a fun-filled isekai life with a beloved pet. Go read â€œIsekaiâ€™d with my dog, I'm not the hero?!â€ on Honeyfeed.

    Contest Winners Prize â€œHR in Another World: Building the Strongest Parties with my Appraisal Skillâ€ by Kaorin

    Hiroyuki, an HR manager, is summoned to another world by a goddess. He has no combat ability whatsoever, but armed with the Divine Appraisal skill, which reveals hidden potential, he recruits allies and assembles the ultimate party. As Hiroyuki builds his team, however, the shadow of an assassin targeting him draws near... In a world far harsher than expected, can this heroâ€™s party stand up to the Demon Lordâ€™s army? A grand adventure begins as Hiroyuki uses his appraisal skills to save the world. Go read â€œHR in Another World: Building the Strongest Parties with my Appraisal Skillâ€ on Honeyfeed.

    Contest Winners Prize â€œDrinking Buddies: Hangover In Another World!â€ by Literate_Manul

    Marcus and Gus are transported to another world while hungover. Desperate to impress an elf princess, they end up boasting that they will â€œdefeat one of the Demon Lordâ€™s generals.â€ By sheer chance, Marcus awakens to beer magic and starts blasting beer while shouting â€œHop Missile!â€, while Gusâ€™s right arm, whose power he cannot consciously control, suddenly awakens... With zero ability and zero planning, but unmatched bravado, these two men launch into a wildly unpredictable isekai buddy comedy! Go read â€œDrinking Buddies: Hangover In Another Worldâ€ on Honeyfeed.

    Overall Review by KADOKAWAâ€™s Editorial Department

    KADOKAWAâ€™s first English-language novel contest on Honeyfeed received 1,240 submissions, the highest number in the platformâ€™s contest history. We are deeply honored by this response and delighted to see such strong interest from English-speaking creators in Japanâ€™s light novel market. Following a rigorous selection process, one Grand Prize winner and two Contest Winners Prize recipients were selected. After initial voting by Honeyfeed users and volunteers, the final judging was conducted by Aneko Yusagi (author of The Rising of the Shield Hero) and editors from KADOKAWA. The Grand Prize winner, Isekaiâ€™d with My Dog, Iâ€™m Not the Hero?!, stood out for its catchy, approachable premise, making it easy to imagine on the shelves of Japanese bookstores. The novel delivers plenty of laugh-out-loud comedic moments, along with charming portrayals of Toast, the adorable dog. We were eager to read more about Toastâ€™s exploits, his bond with the protagonist Mitsuta, and Mitsutaâ€™s growth over the course of the story. The author, Frettiko, will receive a cash award of USD 5,000. The winning work will also be assigned a KADOKAWA editor and is scheduled for translation and publication in Japan, with a target release in 2027. The first Contest Winners Prize recipient, HR in Another World: Building the Strongest Parties with My Appraisal Skill, made effective use of the appraisal skill trope that has become a staple of the isekai genre, while capturing the distinctive feel of Japanese web novels. At the same time, its expansive setting evoked the scope of a large-scale open-world game. The careful portrayal of each character, along with story developments involving figures whose allegiance is unclear, added depth and originality to the narrative. The author, Kaorin, will receive a cash award of USD 3,000. The work will also be assigned a KADOKAWA editor and revised with the aim of translation and publication in Japan. The second Contest Winners Prize recipient, Drinking Buddies: Hangover in Another World!, is a lighthearted comedy that keeps the pages turning. Its one-of-a-kind tone, blending concepts like â€œbeer magicâ€ with a chunibyo-style demonic arm, creates a brand of absurd humor that is strangely compelling. The two protagonists, Marcus and Gus, drinking buddies from our world, are character types rarely seen in Japanese fiction and are likely to feel fresh and distinctive to Japanese readers. The author, Literate_Manul, will receive a cash award of USD 3,000. The work will also be assigned a KADOKAWA editor and revised with the aim of translation and publication in Japan. Going forward, KADOKAWA plans to continue hosting web novel contests in Japan and abroad to discover talented writers from around the world who share a passion for Japanese entertainment content.

    Comment from Aneko Yusagi (author of The Rising of the Shield Hero) on the Grand Prize-Winning Work

    Isekaiâ€™d with My Dog, Iâ€™m Not the Hero?! feels like a novel written with a strong understanding of Japanese light novels. The characters are comical, the pacing is brisk, and the story offers a genuinely light, comedic reading experience. I read it with excitement, eager to see what would unfold in the misadventures of this delightfully mismatched party.

    About MyAnimeList x Honeyfeed Writing Contest 2025 â€“ THE ISEKAI presented by KADOKAWA

    Through this contest, KADOKAWA opened submissions worldwide for English-language isekai fantasy novels, looking for the next hit to follow in the footsteps of globally popular hits such as Overlord, Re:ZERO âˆ’ Starting Life in Another World, The Rising of the Shield Hero, Mushoku Tensei: Jobless Reincarnation, and Sword Art Online.

    About KADOKAWAâ€™s Global UGC Content Development Project

    In recent years, Japanese anime has surged in popularity worldwide, with many hit titles originating from light novels. In parallel, overseas online novel platforms have seen a growing number of works influenced by Japanese light novels, becoming fertile ground for creators with global potential. In response, KADOKAWA launched the Global UGC Content Development Project in 2025 as part of its Global Business Acceleration Program, which supports new overseas-oriented business initiatives. Through this project, KADOKAWA aims to discover global talent from international novel submission platforms and publish their works in Japan and abroad to create new hit IPs. The MyAnimeList x Honeyfeed Writing Contest 2025 â€“ THE ISEKAI presented by KADOKAWA represents the first step in this effort. As another initiative under the same project, KADOKAWA also held the â€œJapan Debut Showdownâ˜†Fantasy Light Novel Contestâ€ in 2025 on KadoKado, a novel submission platform operated by Kadokawa Taiwan Corporation that accepts submissions in Traditional Chinese. The announcement of the winning works is scheduled for June 2026. In addition, plans are underway to publish Why Kill? When Witches Can Be Tentacled!, a work submitted to Honeyfeed, as well as selected winning titles from the JNC Original Light Novel Contest hosted by M12 Media LLC.

    About Honeyfeed

    Honeyfeed is a leading writing platform that empowers authors to create, share, and engage with their original stories. With a vibrant community of readers and writers, Honeyfeed provides an immersive space for storytelling across various genres, including anime and manga-inspired narratives. For more about Honeyfeed, please visit honeyfeed.fm.

    MyAnimeList is one of the worldâ€™s largest communities and databases for Japanese anime and manga, with 16 million registered members from 240 countries and regions worldwide. An indispensable site for tracking anime and manga progress, it holds over 1.2 billion records of viewing and reading big data. Founded in 2004, MyAnimeList has become a crucial source of information for overseas fans, especially among Generation Z in North America. For more about MyAnimeList, please visit myanimelist.net.

  • Each track is built around themes closely connected to Sasaki herself, with the album as a whole shaped by the choices she has made and the people she has encountered along the way, including detours and unexpected turns.
  • The limited first-press edition will include a bonus track, â€œTezukuri no Uta,â€ the first song for which Sasaki wrote both the lyrics and music herself.
  • In addition, tracks from the album will be released digitally over five consecutive months ahead of the full release. The first advance track, â€œMaru de Matryoshka,â€ is now available on streaming services.

    • Comment from Rico Sasaki

    The full album RI PATHOS represents the path I have walked so far. Even when things didnâ€™t go smoothly, moments of uncertainty or stopping to move at my own pace were all important parts of that journey. I believe the time I spent taking those detours was necessary to connect with people I could never have met by moving straight ahead. Driven by passion, this album captures, in new songs, the moments when my soul was deeply moved. Through the five months of advance digital releases and the albumâ€™s release, I would be happy if you would continue walking this path together with me.

Maaya Sakamotoâ€™s New Single â€œTokeiâ€ Now Available on Digital Platforms!
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • Maaya Sakamoto just released her newest digital single â€œTokeiâ€, which has also been chosen as the theme song for the final chapter of popular mobile RPG Fate/Grand Order. The multi-talented singer, voice actress, actress, songwriter and essayist released her 30th anniversary album M30~Your Best~ in October 2025.
  • â€œTokeiâ€ is the sixth track in the Fate/Grand Order series, following â€œShikisaiâ€, â€œGyakkoâ€, â€œKuuhakuâ€, â€œYakudoâ€ and â€œDokuhakuâ€. Maaya Sakamoto wrote the lyrics herself and composed the theme song for the conclusion of the series she has been a part of for ten years.
  • The theme song is an emotional track depicting â€œhope for the futureâ€, setting it apart from previous theme songs from the FGO series. Ryo Eguchi arranged the song, a member of la la larks who helped compose and arrange â€œShikisaiâ€ and the arrangement for â€œGyakkoâ€.
  • The result is a richly-layered track that is fitting for the final chapter of the FGO series, created by a team who know the series by heart.
  • The music video for â€œTokeiâ€ premiered December 29 and features an animated style, numerous characters from the Fate/Grand Order series, and visuals that complement the grand finale of the work and its theme song.
    • https://youtu.be/BGURhEDsAnw

    Release information

    Artist: Maaya Sakamoto Title: Tokei (theme song for final chapter of Mobile RPG Fate/Grand Order) Date: December 28, 2025 Lyrics and composition: Maaya Sakamoto, Arrangement: Ryo Eguchi, String arrangement: Ryo Eguchi and miri

    About Maaya Sakamoto

    Born in Tokyo, she began her career as a child actress at the age of eight. She made her CD debut in 1996 with the single â€œYakusoku wa Iranai.â€ Following her 2011 album You Canâ€™t Catch Me, which topped the Oricon chart, she began actively collaborating with a wide range of other artists and musicians. Since her 2013 album Singer-Songwriter, she has also been composing music for other artists. In 2019, she released her 30th single â€œUchuu no Kiokuâ€ (produced by Ringo Sheena) and her 10th original album Kyou Dake no Ongaku. In 2020, she released her 25th anniversary album Single Collection+ Achikochi and the digital single â€œYakudo,â€ which topped the Oricon chart. In July 2021, her radio program â€œVitamin M,â€ which she had been hosting for 20 years, reached its 1,000th broadcast and entered its 21st year. In May 2022, she released the double tie-up single â€œSumire / Kotoba ni Dekinai,â€ with music written and arranged by Shigeru Kishida. In October 2025, she released her latest album celebrating her 30th anniversary as an artist, M30~Your Best~. To date, she has released 36 singles and 11 full albums. In addition to writing her own original songs, she has also written lyrics for other artists, including Kinki Kidsâ€™ â€œHikari no Kehai,â€ Mamoru Miyanoâ€™s â€œToumei,â€ and WalkÃ¼reâ€™s â€œKaze wa Yokoku Naku Fuku,â€ and has published her own lyrics book Shishu (Kadokawa). She won the 38th Kazuo Kikuta Theater Award for her performance as Jerusha in the musical Daddy-Long-Legs. As of December 12, she is currently appearing in the latest production of Daddy-Long-Legs at Hibiya Theatre Crea as Jerusha for the first time in five years. Her latest essay collection Manpukuron - Asu ni Kaburitsuke (Kadokawa) has also garnered attention. In addition to her singing career, she is active as a voice actress, actress, lyricist, essayist, and radio personality. Her fresh and vibrant voice is loved by fans not only in Japan but also around the world. TV Anime Kirei ni Shitemoraemasu ka OP Theme Song â€œKirei.â€ and ED Theme Song â€œWakaba no Koroâ€ Announced!
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • New information regarding the release of upcoming singles â€œKirei.â€ and â€œWakaba no Koro,â€ the opening and ending theme songs for TV anime Kirei ni Shitemoraemasu ka, have been released. Kirei ni Shitemoraemasu ka, also known as â€œWash It All Awayâ€ in English adaptations, will begin airing January 5, 2026. The original work by popular manga artist Mitsuru Hattori is a heartwarming series that follows a cleaning service based in Atami, Japan.
  • The opening theme song â€œKirei.â€ is performed by up-and-coming singer Yuu., known for her powerful vocal abilities and expressive voice, who has become popular among teens and twenty-somethings with over 370,000 subscribers on YouTube. The song was written and composed by Vocaloid producer Jin, renowned for songs such as â€œYobanashi Deceiveâ€ and â€œSummertime Recordâ€ and for providing music for numerous forms of content.
  • Yuu.â€™s first CD release has also been announced. First edition copies and standard edition copies will be available. The first edition copies will come with a bonus Blu-ray disc. More details will be released at a later date. The standard edition bonus track will be produced by Takaaki Natsushiro, a popular Vocaloid producer, composer and artist known for hit tracks like â€œFrom Tokyo.â€ The first edition bonus track will be produced by popular creator NayutalieN, known for â€œSolar System Discoâ€, an addictive track with over 10 million views on YouTube.
  • The ending theme song â€œWakaba no Koroâ€ is written and performed by songwriter and actress Natsumi Kiyoura. The heartfelt pop song was written through the eyes of the animeâ€™s main character Wakana Kinme. Both the theme song and the additional bonus tracks were produced by Katsutoshi Kitagawa from Round Table, who has supported Kiyouraâ€™s live performances throughout the years.
  • Kiyouraâ€™s latest artist photo has also been released! The photo and CD jacket were photographed in Atami, where the upcoming anime takes place. CD jacket details will be released at a later date.
  • Both opening and ending theme songs will be available to stream January 5, 2026!

    • Comments From Yuu. (Singer for OP Theme Song â€œKirei.â€)

    Iâ€™m Yuu., nice to meet you!Itâ€™s an honor to perform the opening theme song. Iâ€™m very happy to be singing my very first anime theme song at 20 years old! I sang while imagining the beautiful sea of Atami and cherishing the human connections and feelings of warmth that are evident throughout this story. I hope you enjoy this anime while appreciating the heartwarming scenes and feelings it evokes.

    Comment From Jin (Writer and Composer for OP Theme Song â€œKirei.â€)

    Things that are clean, transparent, and tidy. Things that change shape over time. Things that are layered with stains and scratches that give them character. â€œKireiâ€ comes to mind. Such a word that is soaked in human emotion is the theme of this song.

    Comment From Natsumi Kiyoura (Singer and Lyrics for ED Theme Song â€œWakaba no Koroâ€)

    My first impression of the original manga left me pondering Ms. Kinmeâ€™s dedication to her work and her kindness, as well as the dappling sunlight through the trees and seasons we see during our everyday life. â€œWakaba no Koroâ€ captures the feelings of early summer, fleeting moments of youth, and singular pages in the story of life. You can trust the ending theme song for this anime in my hands.

    Comment From Katsutoshi Kitagawa (Producer for ED Theme Song â€œWakaba no Koroâ€)

    Having lived in Hakodate until high school, imagining life in a coastal town brought back memories. Like biking to the shore and spending the afternoon with a paperback book. I thought Iâ€™d like to make a song that is filled with the essence of the original work and my memories like the smell of a seaside town. I hope you can feel the softness of the acoustic guitar and string instruments and the warmth of the woodwinds.

    About Yuu.

    Born December 22, 2005. She began singing as a child and started posting covers of songs on YouTube at 12 years old. At 13 years old, she was releasing high-quality cover songs with the mixing and producing all handled by herself. Upon graduating high school, she began to take her hobby as a musical artist more seriously. On the last day of high school, she released her first single â€œSeishun Saigo no 1 Pageâ€ with her acquaintance SAKURAmoti, another Vocaloid producer of the same age. Her song about the sentimental feelings of school life, and her cheerful and unique voice, encouraged many of her peers. Afterwards, her a cappella short videos became popular on YouTube and TikTok, gaining approximately 200,000 subscribers in just a few months. As of December 2025, her YouTube subscriber count has surpassed 370,000. In August 2025, she released her second single, â€œHighlight!â€. Her popularity caught the attention of a record label, she was chosen to sing the theme song to TV anime Kirei ni Shitemoraemasu ka, premiering January 2026! Keep an eye on this rising star and her future activities as a solo singer. SNS Platforms X: x.com/Yuu_mr_ YouTube: youtube.com/@Yuu_mr TikTok: tiktok.com/@yuu_mr

    About Natsumi Kiyoura

    Born in Chiba, Japan July 4, 1990. She debuted as a film and TV actress at age 12. Her music career launched in 2007 with her single â€œKaze Sagashiâ€, released by Flying Dog. She formed the group Tweedees in 2015 and went on to release four more albums and two mini-albums through Nippon Columbia. In 2024, she released her first solo mini-album Breakfast. She left TWEEDEES in March 2025 to pursue activities as a solo artist. She has participated as a vocalist in a wide range of works including commercials, movies, dramas, anime, and games. She is also active as a lyricist and provides songs to other artists. item.title: [Honeyâ€™s Anime Interview] Nowlu: The Voice Behind â€œShirogarasuâ€ and Her New EP "Dose"
item.content:encoded:
With a growing international fanbase and a sound thatâ€™s been catching more and more ears, Nowlu is becoming a name people donâ€™t just hear, but remember. We had the chance to talk with her once again, this time about her new EP, the journey so far, and the mindset behind the artist fans have come to love.

Nowlu
Honey-Chan
Interview with Nowlu
[gray-hex-decoration]
Hello, Nowlu. Welcome back to Honey's Anime! So, for those who don't know you, your artist name â€œNowluâ€ is described as combining the words â€œNight," "Owl." and "Lunaâ€. Could you tell us how you came up with this name, and which aspects of those words resonate with your music?
Thank you! Nowlu comes from the image of a lone owl spreading its wings toward the moon (or the world) at night. My team and I explored words inspired by my voice and discussed them until we arrived at this name. Itâ€™s difficult to compare the words individually, but I feel the â€œNightâ€ aspect shines through most strongly in the worlds my voice creates.
Thatâ€™s so cool and poetic! Your music often blends R&B, neoâ€cityâ€pop, 80s/90s inspired beats, and a smoky voice. How do you balance these stylistic elements with your own personal sound?
When I sing, I try to preserve a sense of nostalgia while also challenging myself with new things.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6DgXTP6Y59I
Can you tell us about your most recent release, the ending theme of the TV anime "Mugen Gacha" (Backstabbed in a Backwater Dungeon)? What kind of feeling or message did you want listeners to carry with them after hearing â€˜Shirogarasuâ€™?
â€œShirogarasuâ€ means â€œwhite crow.â€ In this song, the crow symbolizes revenge and white symbolizes justice. A white crow is a metaphor for something impossible, which ties into the story, and it also reflects the protagonist Light, who carries both light and shadow within him. That overlap made the title feel like a perfect fit. Flight usually carries a positive image of moving forward with determination, but I approached it from a different angle. The lyrics contain traces of irony toward those driven by revenge, as if saying â€œIâ€™m above you.â€ The words evoke a â€œquietly burning inner blue flame,â€ and the sharp, spicy piano lines give it a tingling edge, creating a sophisticated, cool house track. I hope listeners enjoy that interplay. Even if the storyâ€™s exhilarating moments leave you drained, I think this song will help you remember your purpose again and serve as the fuel that carries you to the next episode.
Your new EP 'Dose' was released on September 1, 2025 and features six previously released songs and the brand-new title track of the same name. In choosing to build the EP around your earlier works together with this new song, what was your intention behind the title Dose? How do you see the title track reflecting your growth or change as an artist, especially compared with the previous songs included?
The new song â€œDoseâ€ opens the EP, and from there, the previously released tracks trace my journey. Itâ€™s like a profile of the path Iâ€™ve walked so far. â€œDoseâ€ is about a truly painful night in my life. I felt the fear and loneliness of being unnecessary, and the vague anxiety of wondering how long it would last, until it built up to the point where I could barely breathe. It was terrifying and agonizing. Humans tend to beautify memories, so eventually even this will fade and be forgotten. At the time, I wanted to forget it because it was so painful, but I also remembered the desperate notes I had scribbled during those days. â€œDoseâ€ was actually the working title. Itâ€™s a word of resignation in Japanese, but it was this word that somehow pulled me out of that unbearable suffering. I decided to turn it into a song because I felt that the memory of that night, and the emotional outburst it carried, might offer comfort to someone else. Even though itâ€™s a song born from despair, I also wanted people to feel the melody and move to it. So I focused on singing in a more danceable, groovy way than usual. I hope that comes through.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qdZPNeEBTbo
Your song â€œStuck on you,â€ one of our favorites, achieved major streaming success overseas, especially in North America. How does it feel to have an international audience, and how do you keep in mind the global listeners when creating music?
This year, I performed live overseas for the first time, in Brazil and Malaysia, and had the chance to meet listeners face-to-face. Thatâ€™s when I truly felt, â€œAh, I really am Nowlu.â€ (laughs) At the same time, I was genuinely amazed that, even in countries with different languages, there are listeners singing along with Japanese lyrics. Itâ€™s such a wonderful and heartwarming experience, and it reminded me once again of just how incredible Japanese anime is. Because I have so many global listeners, Iâ€™m particularly careful with my lyrics and ways of expressing myself, aiming to let people feel the beauty and depth of the Japanese language.
Are there any songs in your repertoire that you feel more personally connected to, or that tell a story youâ€™re especially proud of?
Of course, all of my songs and works are meaningful, but if I had to choose, Iâ€™d say â€œYoinâ€ and â€œDose.â€ â€œYoinâ€ is a song about a fresh start and was also the ending theme for my first TV drama (Wingman), so itâ€™s deeply memorable and holds a special place in my heart, fulfilling a dream Iâ€™ve had since childhood. â€œDoseâ€ isnâ€™t just cool musically, itâ€™s very much a reflection of my heart. I hope to make it a song that many people can love deeply and for a long time.
And where do you imagine yourself artistically in five years? Any dream projects, genres to explore, or performance venues to conquer?
I want to be surrounded by the voices of tens of thousands of people singing my songs. Absolutely. I also want to keep expressing, through my words and poetry, what I believe is right, along with a touch of irony, without compromise. A major goal of mine is to stand on the stage of Madison Square Garden, where the person I admired and who inspired me to start singing once stood, and take in the same view they saw.
When her latest EP was released, we had it on repeat for days. And now, after talking with Nowlu, itâ€™s easy to understand why people connect with her music: thereâ€™s honesty, a little grit, and a lot of heart behind everything she creates. If you havenâ€™t already, check out her new EP 'Dose' or dive into her earlier tracks. You can also follow her on social media to keep up with her news and future releases.

item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • Daoko has released a music video for â€œRhythm in the Sunset,â€ the lead track from her latest digital EP meta millefeuille, which came out on November 19, 2025.
  • The popular â€œisekaiâ€ fantasy series Easygoing Territory Defense by the Optimistic Lord: Production Magic Turns a Nameless Village into the Strongest Fortified City has gained a following for its thrilling exploits and the unyielding personalities of its characters, with over 2.5 million physical and digital copies sold.
  • The video was directed by Yuichiro Saeki, who previously handled Daokoâ€™s music videos â€œOtogi no Machiâ€ and â€œKaeritai!â€ and is currently joining her Asia tour as a VJ. The piece blends nostalgic footage from Daokoâ€™s everyday life with modern graphics, creating a warm, 2000s-inspired work that evokes brief flashes of memory.
    • https://youtu.be/oTyn9eP8oGE

    Daokoâ€™s Comment

    I put this song together by arranging my favorite words found in everyday life to match namitapeâ€™s exciting sound. While creating it, I pictured scenes from a walk, and with that image in mind, I wanted the music video to feel familiar and approachable, so I asked Director Saeki, with whom I have a close relationship and whom I deeply respect. The shoot was very enjoyable, with a calm, pleasant atmosphere throughout. The gentle expressions we captured during that warm, sunlit moment are closer to my natural self than what Iâ€™ve shown before, which makes me feel a little shy, but Director Saeki brought everything together beautifully, so I hope you enjoy it.

    Yuichiro Saeki's Comment

    I hope you can enjoy Daokoâ€™s expressions and gestures, which shine with a unique radiance while remaining true to herself, together with the world of the song.

    Video Credits

    Starring: Daoko Director: Yuichiro Saeki Director of Photography: Ryuichi Taniura Camera Assistant: Kaoru Noguchi Stylist: Mika Masuda Hair & Makeup: Natsuho Makino Lyric Design: Minoru Shimizu Location Support: Chofu Film Commission Producer: Masato Kudo Produced by FAB A music video for the EP track â€œMeeMâ€ is scheduled to be released on December 3. The digital EP meta millefeuille, featuring â€œRhythm in the Sunsetâ€ and â€œMeeM,â€ is available now. It includes five tracks in total, among them the July single â€œZense wa BushÅâ€ (arranged by Seiichi Nagai), the September single â€œBoku dake no Photonâ€ (arranged by x0o0x_), and â€œIiyo,â€ the opening theme for the TV anime Who Made Me a Princess, arranged by GuruConnect. The artwork is by rising illustrator Yu. Under the theme of â€œkawaii,â€ the collection brings together a series of finely crafted pop tracks that showcase Daokoâ€™s sharp, distinctive sensibility and her intimate connection to everyday life, marking her latest musical direction.

    Daoko's Profile

    Tokyo-born in 1997, Daoko rose to prominence at 15 with a song uploaded to Niconico Douga, making her major debut in 2015. Since then, sheâ€™s been active across music, anime, and commercial projects. Her hit collaboration with Kenshi Yonezu, â€œUchiage Hanabi,â€ has surpassed 600 million views on YouTube. A multi-talented creator, Daoko has also written novels, organized live events, held painting exhibitions, and acted, earning high acclaim both in Japan and abroad. She founded her own agency, teftef, in 2019. Alongside her solo activities, she began performing as part of the band QUBIT in 2023. In 2024, she released her first solo album in about four years, Slash-&-Burn, and drew attention with her featured appearance on Shiina Ringoâ€™s seventh album track, â€œa grand triumphant return.â€ In 2025, she attracted further notice for her collaboration with Giga & TeddyLoid, â€œACT feat.   • On November 9, the four-member female vocal and dance group PassCode held their arena concert PassCode YOKOHAMA BUNTAI 2025 â€œDESTINEXâ€ at Yokohama BUNTAI in Kanagawa. Marking their first arena performance in about three years and nine months since their 2022 Budokan show, the event was a special occasion for both the group and their fans. On this day, they surprised the audience with the first-ever live performance of their latest song â€œLiberator,â€ announced as the opening theme for the TV anime Roll Over and Die, set to begin airing in January 2026. They also revealed that the song will be released as a single on March 4, 2026.
  • Published by Micro Magazine, Roll Over and Die is a dark fantasy story about the protagonist, Flum, who, despite having zero stats, is chosen by the God Origin to join the Heroâ€™s Party and continues to push forward alongside newfound companions. PassCodeâ€™s opening theme â€œLiberatorâ€ can be heard in the animeâ€™s newly released PV.
  • Alongside the single announcement, PassCode unveiled a new artist photo featuring the denim-based outfits worn at Yokohama BUNTAI. The fresh visual marks a shift from their previous images, showcasing a brighter, more pop-inspired style.
  • It was also announced that the Yokohama BUNTAI concert will be exclusively streamed on U-NEXT, with the streaming start date to be revealed later via PassCodeâ€™s official social media. Leading up to that release, several past performances will be available for unlimited streaming: PassCode ASIA TOUR 2024 Final at Zepp Osaka Bayside on November 13, PassCode presents VERSUS PASSCODE 2024 Vol.2 at Spotify O-EAST on November 27, and PassCode Zephyren 10th Anniversary A.V.E.S.T project Kodo at Yoyogi National Stadium First Gymnasium on December 18.   • AVIOT, operated by Preseed Japan Corporation, which manufactures and sells consumer electronics, has released its The Prince of Tennis II collaboration true wireless earbuds in North America. The earbuds are available in two models themed after the seriesâ€™ iconic schools: TE-V1R-TP1, inspired by Seishun Academy (Seigaku), and TE-V1R-TP2, inspired by Rikkai University-Affiliated Middle School (Rikkai).
  • Based on the TE-V1R, the TE-V1R-TP1 and TE-V1R-TP2 are special edition wireless earbuds designed to fully capture the charm of The Prince of Tennis II.
  • The Seigaku model includes voices from nine characters: Ryoma Echizen, Kunimitsu Tezuka, Shuichiro Oishi, Shusuke Fuji, Sadaharu Inui, Eiji Kikumaru, Takashi Kawamura, Takeshi Momoshiro, and Kaoru Kaido. The Rikkai model includes eight characters: Seiichi Yukimura, Genichiro Sanada, Renji Yanagi, Masaharu Niou, Hiroshi Yagyu, Bunta Marui, Jackal Kuwahara, and Akaya Kirihara.
  • Together, the two models contain 350 newly recorded voice lines, from operational voice guidance for notifications like power and connection status to a â€œrandom voiceâ€ function that plays memorable quotes from the series. Users can switch between 17 modes through the dedicated app.
  • From the earbuds and charging case to the packaging, every detail has been carefully crafted for a premium, fan-focused experience, with audio tuned by series composer UZA for optimal music playback. In the promotional video, Ryoma Echizen and Kunimitsu Tezuka themselves introduce the products. Please check it out!
    • https://youtu.be/MZGwMhqIjcE

    Product Characteristics

    Base Model The TE-V1R is the latest model in AVIOTâ€™s popular V series, which has sold approximately 190,000 units*. The earbuds offer an ultra-long battery life of 19 hours (62 hours with the charging case) and Adaptive Hybrid Noise Canceling, which automatically adjusts the noise reduction strength based on the surrounding environment. They also feature the new Hybrid Dual Driver 2.0 for enhanced sound quality, LDACâ„¢ support for high-resolution playback, and wireless charging functionality, making them a high-grade model that perfectly balances sound quality and functionality. *As of the end of April 2025 Special Voice Lines The earbuds feature over 350 newly recorded lines across two models, including voice guidance for notifications such as power and connection status, as well as a â€œrandom voiceâ€ function with memorable quotes from the series. The Seigaku model offers 9 modes featuring Ryoma and teammates, while the Rikkai model includes 8 modes featuring Yukimura and his teammates. To see the other voice lines, please check the product page: aviot.jp/product/te-v1r-tp. Special Design The charging cases feature color schemes inspired by Seigaku and Rikkai, with a glossy finish for a premium feel. The sides of the cases and the metal parts of the earbuds are adorned with original logos based on the series title, creating a design that captures the animeâ€™s world while blending naturally into everyday use.
    [sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]
    Special Packaging The packaging showcases brand-new illustrations of the players enjoying the earbuds, highlighting their expressions and charm.
    [sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]
    Special Tuning The sound was tuned by UZA, who composed the soundtrack for The Prince of Tennis II, creating a unique audio experience that lets you feel the excitement of the Prince of Tennis Festival wherever you are. Comment from Composer UZA â€œWith this tuning, my goal was to recreate the atmosphere of the Prince of Tennis Festival. I drew on songs from across the seriesâ€™ 20-plus-year history as reference material, but with such a long history, the volume levels and sound quality varied widely, which made finding the right balance a real challenge. When in doubt, I went back to my roots: I listened to the first seasonâ€™s opening, â€œfuture,â€ and adjusted the sound so the lows and mids would carry more weight, while the highs would highlight the richness and vibrancy of the artistsâ€™ and voice actorsâ€™ voices. I hope youâ€™ll feel the same excitement as if you were actually at a Prince of Tennis Festival. Whether recording, mixing, or mastering, I always strive for the best balance and sound quality, and through this collaboration with AVIOT, I was reminded that sound can always keep evolving. Thank you!â€ About UZA UZA (Lyricist, Composer, Sound Producer, Singer-Songwriter) Born in Tokyo on April 23, 1970. He began his career in 1993 after participating in â€œBAD AUDITION,â€ organized by Being, and signed an exclusive songwriter contract with the company. After going freelance in 1999, he focused on club music with a strong Western influence. In 2001, with the first season opening of The Prince of Tennis, â€œfuture,â€ he became involved in producing many anime songs. In 2006, he founded Aglets Entertainment, taking a more hands-on role in production, from songwriting and composing to planning, recording, and mastering. In 2019, he opened the Aglets Music School, dedicating himself to nurturing new talent. Major Collaborations: AKB48, Masayuki Suzuki, Hiromi Iwasaki, Ryu Si-won, Tackey & Tsubasa, Maki Goto, Bless4, Yui Horie, Aki Toyosaki, Yui Makino, and others. His work spans a wide range, from anime songs for The Prince of Tennis, GeGeGe no Kitaro, and the Pretty Cure series, to music production for stage performances such as Kinichi Hagimotoâ€™s Meijiza shows, as well as sound production for corporate mascots, including those for GMO Internet and Kanro. In 2015, at the request of his hometown, Higashimurayama City, he created the departure and arrival chimes for Higashimurayama Station using a traditional local folk song. On August 31, 2022, he released his fourth full album, Yumeutsutsu, through Bellwood Records.

  • Up and coming singer Rei Nakashima, winner of the InuCon! 2022 grand prix, will be releasing her highly anticipated third single â€œOkirakuze~shonâ€ February 18, 2026! The song was produced by Hyadain (Kenichi Maeyamada) and chosen as the opening theme song for TV anime Easygoing Territory Defense by the Optimistic Lord.
  • Written by renowned hit-maker Kenichi Maeyamada, â€œOkirakuze~shonâ€ is a lively track that deviates from Rei Nakashimaâ€™s previous image. Rei Nakashimaâ€™s laid-back style and the fun-filled atmosphere of the track result in a relaxed and easygoing pop song. Its upbeat, cheery melody and Nakashimaâ€™s silky smooth vocals pair perfectly with the feel of the anime and will invite listeners to sit back and take a load off. mekakusheâ€™s New Song â€œSpace Gateâ€ Now Streaming! Full Tracklist Revealed for Upcoming Album Love After 13.8 Billion Years!
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • Singer-songwriter mekakushe has released a new song titled â€œSpace Gateâ€ on streaming services. This track is a pre-release from her upcoming digital album Love After 13.8 Billion Years, which will be out on November 7, 2025. Written and composed by mekakushe and arranged by Kosuke Hayashi of Scenarioart, â€œSpace Gateâ€ is a beautifully crafted medium-tempo ballad that expresses a yearning for pop music through a rich, live arrangement. The jacket illustration and music video were created by illustrator Otsukimi.
    • https://youtu.be/Hj4Tg9Eu1P0

    Product Information

    Track Title: â€œSpace Gateâ€ Lyrics/Composition: mekakusheã€€ Arrangement: Kosuke Hayashi (Scenarioart) Jacket Art: Otsukimi On streaming websites: linkco.re/TZan8fg4

    Digital Album Love After 13.8 Billion Years Tracklist

    1. Retronym of Love (ED theme of Kowloon Generic Romance) 2. Rendezvous 3. Oyasumi Beige 4. Kimi wa Snorkel 5. Zutto Emerald 6. Yuwanamerou (insert song from Kowloon Generic Romance) 7. Snow Globe Galaxy 8. My Own Polaris (insert song from Kowloon Generic Romance) 9. Sky Above 10. Space Gate Pre-add/Pre-save: linkco.re/HrHzqSFv

    Mekakusheâ€™s Comment

    When we are born, and when we die, we are all alone. Even when youâ€™re beside me, I am still alone. That loneliness feels unbearable sometimes. Unless youâ€”Loneliness itselfâ€”knock on the door of dawn, my night will never end. But lately, Iâ€™ve begun to think maybe thatâ€™s alright. Itâ€™s okay to be lonely. Because Iâ€™m lonely, I want to be with you. Because Iâ€™m lonely, I sing. And I want to feel joy in that. May my album Love After 13.8 Billion Years never stop playing. May I keep wandering through your universe, even in the next life.

    Kyabeshiâ€™s Comment

    Just like you see different scenes when you flip a snow globe, weâ€™ve packed a variety of scenes into this music video. Iâ€™d love to hear how this video, this world, looks to you. P.S. I secretly hid seven shrimp, Mekakusheâ€™s favorite, somewhere in the video. See if you can find them!

    Meyocoâ€™s Comment

    Itâ€™s an honor to create an artwork for mekakushe-sanâ€™s music. I had a lot of fun creating the illustration from beginning to end. I was given the chance to create the artwork according to my style, which I deeply appreciate. The main theme I wanted to cover is a combination of â€œtimeâ€ and â€œspace,â€ with the motif of the clock being a dominant element in the artwork alongside the girl. I wanted the artworks to look warm and peaceful, the way you would feel when remembering someone you love. I hope my illustrations could serve well as a companion to mekakushe-sanâ€™s music.

    Comment from Kousuke Hayashi (Scenarioart)

    I arranged the song to evoke a sense of nostalgia in anyoneâ€™s heart. While working on it, I found comfort in how the music seemed to gently loosen the heart, like returning to a shared hometown.

    Comment from Otsukimi

    Iâ€™m truly honored to have been asked to create the music video for â€œSpace Gate.â€ I had a wonderful time illustrating a world inspired by the moon, the stars, and the cosmos. The rotating merry-go-round scene is especially dear to me. It came together through many rounds of brainstorming and careful fine-tuning. The reversal of its rotation between the first and second halves expresses the emotional shift of the girl in the story. I hope you enjoy this touch along with the beautiful song and lyrics.

    Kousuke Hayashiâ€™s Profile

    Vocalist and guitarist for the rock band Scenarioart, Kosuke also works as a lyricist, composer, and arranger. X: x.com/kosukedao

    Otsukimiâ€™s Profile

    A Tokyo-based illustrator whose work centers on the theme of â€œsoftness with a touch of romance.â€ Known for designs featuring moon and star motifs that bring out the gentle charm of girls. X: x.com/otsukimi8ã€€ Instagram: instagram.com/_o_tsukimi_

    Mekakusheâ€™s Profile

    Handling lyrics, composition, vocals, and piano performance by herself, the next-generation singer-songwriter Mekakushe enjoys immense popularity among artists and creators. Starting classical piano at the age of three, she gradually gravitated towards pop music. Her independently produced songs were featured in a Kao Laurier commercial, and she was one of the top artists on the Spotify official playlist â€œKirakira Pop Japanâ€ with a total of 3 million plays. She is a promising emerging artist with anticipated future success. With electronica as the foundation in her recordings, her musical style continues to expand, featuring classical solos and band sets in live performances. Official YouTube channel: youtube.com/@_mekakushe_ Official X: twitter.com/_mekakushe_ Official Instagram: instagram.com/_mekakushe_ Official TikTok: tiktok.com/@_mekakushe_ Official homepage: mekakushe.com

[Honey's Anime Interview] ASH Talks Ultraman, Inspiration, and Whatâ€™s Next for ASH DA HERO
item.content:encoded:
Once again, weâ€™re thrilled to welcome ASH, the charismatic frontman of ASH DA HERO, for another interview with Honeyâ€™s Anime! Known for his powerful vocals and boundless energy, ASH has been captivating audiences both in Japan and overseas with his bandâ€™s electrifying performances. Following the release of â€œKyoukai Revolution,â€ the ending theme for the second half of Ultraman Omega, ASH sat down with us once again to talk about his love for the Ultraman series, the creative process behind the new songs, and what fans can look forward to during the bandâ€™s ongoing world tour.

ASH
Honey-Chan
Interview with ASH from ASH DA HERO
[gray-hex-decoration]
We love the Ultraman Omega opening and ending themes. How would you describe the connection of â€œBRIGHT EYES,â€ and which elements of the series influenced the music and lyrics of the song?
Itâ€™s truly an honor. From NARASAKI, who composed the music, and Matsui, who wrote the lyrics, I received a song of great importance. The moment I first heard the demo, I thought, â€œThis is Ultraman.â€ Iâ€™ve been a huge fan of the Ultraman series since childhood, right up to now. For all six years of elementary school, I used to write letters to Ultraman. I would even get replies, and reading those letters was part of my childhood. Thatâ€™s why, with all my love for Ultraman, I put my heart into singing every single note, hoping to give courage to the children who will grow up watching Omega. Who knows, maybe among those kids, there will be someone who dreams of becoming a musician and one day sings a theme song like I did. I want to keep passing the baton into the future.
You incorporated rap and lyrics into "Missing Link," the ending theme with MindaRyn. Do you prefer rapping or singing, and which do you find more challenging to perform live?
Both are part of my expression and my roots. I donâ€™t find either one more challenging than the other. I always strive to give my best and make sure Iâ€™m fully prepared.
https://youtu.be/vkyJG809-mQ
Now, ASH DA HERO is currently on a world tour. What has this experience been like so far? Do you have a road story you'd like to share with your fans?
Itâ€™s been full of interesting experiences. One tour story that stands out is from San Antonio, Texas. When I sang Deep in the Heart of Texas, the audience sang along and clapped with me, which was both wonderful and hilarious! Everyone in San Antonio was laughing, kind of like, â€œWhy?â€ I really love surprises like that.
And what can ASH DA HERO fans anticipate for the rest of the dates of the tour? Could you offer a sneak peek into the stage setup or setlist?
We plan to play new songs from our new album. And of course, weâ€™ll play the Omega song as well. A special guest has also been confirmed to join us.
That's so exciting! So, what are your plans for 2026?
Iâ€™m going to immediately start working on new music. Please look forward to it!
We always talk about your amazing career, and how fans have been follow you for so long, but what are some of your preferred songs and music videos that you would suggest to new listeners?
Iâ€™d love for them to listen to HYPERBEAT! It turned out to be an amazing album!
As always, ASHâ€™s passion for music and his genuine connection with fans shine through in every word and performance. With HYPERBEAT marking an exciting new chapter for ASH DA HERO and more music already in the works, thereâ€™s plenty for fans to look forward to. Weâ€™d like to thank ASH once again for taking the time to speak with us, and we canâ€™t wait to see what comes next from this unstoppable force of rock.

item.title: mekakusheâ€™s New Song â€œSnow Globe Galaxyâ€ Now Streaming! Jacket Art for Upcoming Album 138-Oku Nen Me no Koi Revealed!
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • Singer-songwriter mekakushe has released a new song, â€œSnow Globe Galaxy.â€ This track is a pre-release from the digital album 138 Oku-nen Me no Koi, scheduled for release on November 7, 2025. Written and composed by mekakushe and arranged by Sondai Nishijima, the song is a two-step track that condenses three minutes of technical beats, as if the universe itself were trapped inside a snow globe. The jacket art and music video were created by collage artist kyabeshi.
  • The jacket art for 138 Oku-nen Me no Koi has also been revealed. It was created by Southeast Asiaâ€“based illustrator Meyoco, an Instagram influencer with over 1.17 million followers who also runs her own apparel line. In addition to the main artwork, she drew complementary illustrations, which will appear on acrylic panels distributed as special gifts for the 1st and 2nd stages of mekakushe Planetarium Acoustic Live ~138 Oku-nen Me no Koi~ on November 27.
    • https://youtu.be/pDI2RVFDg78

    Product Information

    Track Title: â€œSnow Globe Galaxyâ€ Lyrics/Composition: mekakusheã€€ Arrangement: Sondai Nishijima Jacket Art: Kyabeshi On streaming websites: linkco.re/5TdgzZRr

    Mekakusheâ€™s Comment

    Snow globes are beautiful and lonely, holding beginnings and endings, a fleeting eternity trapped inside. When I was little, I loved gazing at them. An infinite world fit in the palm of my hand, self-contained, compressed into a single space, and it made my heart race. Music feels the same. It ends eventually, but for a moment, it becomes my own small, enclosed world of beauty. This song is like a snow globe you can listen to, three minutes capturing beginnings and endings, beauty and loneliness, all in one.

    Sondai Nishijimaâ€™s Comment

    â€œSnow Globe Galaxyâ€ is the wild card of the album, packed with surprises in its short runtime. Its signature lies in rollercoaster-like twists and technical beats. I asked Mekakushe to tackle many challenging harmonies and choruses (sorry!), and she sang beautifully, bringing to life a one-of-a-kind snow globe. Enjoy!

    Kyabeshiâ€™s Comment

    Just like you see different scenes when you flip a snow globe, weâ€™ve packed a variety of scenes into this music video. Iâ€™d love to hear how this video, this world, looks to you. P.S. I secretly hid seven shrimp, Mekakusheâ€™s favorite, somewhere in the video. See if you can find them!

    Meyocoâ€™s Comment

    Itâ€™s an honor to create an artwork for mekakushe-sanâ€™s music. I had a lot of fun creating the illustration from beginning to end. I was given the chance to create the artwork according to my style, which I deeply appreciate. The main theme I wanted to cover is a combination of â€œtimeâ€ and â€œspace,â€ with the motif of the clock being a dominant element in the artwork alongside the girl. I wanted the artworks to look warm and peaceful, the way you would feel when remembering someone you love. I hope my illustrations could serve well as a companion to mekakushe-sanâ€™s music.

    138-Oku Nen Me no Koi Tracklist

    Retronym of Love (ED theme of Kowloon Generic Romance) Zutto Emerald Kimi wa Snorkel My Own Polaris (insert song from Kowloon Generic Romance) Yuwanamerou (insert song from Kowloon Generic Romance) Sky Above Rendezvous Snow Globe Galaxy And other new songs *Tracklist subject to change. Final order and content may be updated without notice.

    Sondai Nishijimaâ€™s Profile

    Sondai Nishijima began experimenting with digital music production while at university and launched his activities as a Vocaloid producer. His work includes contributing songs to the TV anime Ore no Imouto ga Konnani Kawaii Wake ga Nai (Season 2), performing piano for The Idolmaster (Bandai Namco) songs, writing lyrics for Denenbu (Bandai Namco), providing music for Break My Case (coly), and writing columns for Singing Synthesizer Music Magazine (Stripeless Label).   • ASH and MindaRyn will perform the ending theme for part 2 of the tokusatsu drama Ultraman Omega, which has been airing in Japan since July 2025.
  • Following the opening theme â€œBRIGHT EYESâ€ (ASH) and the part 1 ending theme â€œMissing Linkâ€ (MindaRyn feat. ASH), the two artists team up again for the part 2 ending theme, bringing a fresh chapter to life. The new song is titled â€œKyoumei Revolutionâ€ (Resonance Revolution).
  • Part 2 of Ultraman Omega begins in October. â€œKyoumei Revolutionâ€ is a high-energy rock track that blends the powerful voices of ASH and MindaRyn, with lyrics crafted to complement the series and a dynamic vocal interplay in the chorus as standout elements.
  • The single will be released on October 22, featuring cover art of Omega wearing the Valgenes Armor and wielding the Valgenes Halberd. Pre-release streaming will begin on October 11, giving fans the chance to hear the track ahead of the CD release.

    ASH's Profile

    Vocalist of the four-member band ASH DA HERO. A singer with a versatile style rooted in rock, punk, and hip hop. Known for his dynamic voice and commanding live performances, he has contributed to tie-ins ranging from the TV anime Blue Lock to New Japan Pro-Wrestling. The second cour opening theme for Blue Lock, â€œJudgement,â€ has surpassed 5 million views on YouTube and 30 million streams worldwide, drawing significant attention. He actively communicates in English and other languages, and his overseas fanbase continues to grow. Currently on the ASH DA HERO â€œWORLD TOURâ€ 2025, he has completed successful shows in the U.S., Brazil, the UAE, South Korea, and more. Based on the TE-V1R, this special edition features over 350 newly recorded voice lines by four members of the anti-kaiju robot force STORAGE and four Ultraman, original earbud design and packaging, and sound tuning by Masaaki Endoh.
  • From the packaging and design to the voice guidance and sound tuning, the TE-V1R-ULZ has been fully customized in tribute to Ultraman Z.
  • The earbuds and charging case feature a color scheme inspired by the STORAGE unit insignia, blending a military aesthetic with the heroic spirit of the Ultraman universe.
  • In addition to voice guidance for notifications like power and connection status, these earbuds feature a â€œrandom voiceâ€ function packed with memorable lines from the show. Altogether, 350 newly recorded voice lines are included across 14 modes, including 6 duo modes with interactions between the four STORAGE members (Haruki Natsukawa, Shota Hebikura, Yoko Nakashima, and Yuka Ohta) and the four Ultraman (Ultraman Z, Ultraman Zero, Ultraman Geed, and Ultraman Belial).

  • The sound tuning was supervised by Masaaki Endoh, vocalist of the opening theme â€œI ask that you chant my name!â€

    Base Model The TE-V1R is the latest model in AVIOTâ€™s popular V series, which has sold approximately 190,000 units*. The earbuds offer an ultra-long battery life of 19 hours (62 hours with the charging case) and Adaptive Hybrid Noise Canceling, which automatically adjusts the noise reduction strength based on the surrounding environment. They also feature the new Hybrid Dual Driver 2.0 for enhanced sound quality, LDACâ„¢ support for high-resolution playback, and wireless charging functionality, making them a high-grade model that perfectly balances sound quality and functionality. *As of the end of April 2025 Special Voice Lines In addition to voice guidance for notifications like power and connection status, these earbuds feature a â€œrandom voiceâ€ function packed with memorable lines from the show. With over 350 voice lines, this dream collaboration of legendary heroes comes to life right in your ears. Sample voice clips will be released on the product page. Be sure to check them out! Special Design The earbuds and charging case design are inspired by the anti-kaiju robot force â€œSTORAGEâ€ and feature colors matching the unit insignia. While embracing a military aesthetic, the metallic gold accents evoke the Power of Light and the Rise Ultra Medals, capturing the heroic spirit of the Ultra heroes.

Additionally, two types of oversleeves are included: one featuring Ultraman Z & Ultraman Zero, and another featuring Ultraman Geed & Ultraman Belial. Itâ€™s a thoughtfully crafted set designed to be enjoyed in three ways.

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • AVIOT, operated by Preseed Japan Corporation, which manufactures and sells consumer electronics, has opened pre-orders for the TE-Q3-BSF true wireless earbuds, created in collaboration with the visual novel BUSTAFELLOWS. Based on the TE-Q3, this special edition features a total of 150 newly recorded voice lines by the protagonist Teuta and five male characters, exclusive new illustrations by artist Kohaku Sumeragi, and sound tuning by KENN.
  • From the packaging and design to the voice guidance and sound tuning, the TE-Q3-BSF has been fully customized in tribute to BUSTAFELLOWS.
  • The packaging features brand-new artwork by series illustrator Kohaku Sumeragi, and the earbuds themselves capture the distinctive atmosphere of the visual novel. In addition to the protagonist Teuta, five male characters working behind the scenes in New Sieg provide voice guidance. With seven modes in total, including a duo mode with character interactions, the earbuds feature over 150 newly recorded voice lines, along with sound tuning supervised by KENN, making them a must-have for fans of the series.

    • Product Characteristics

    Base Model This collaboration model is based on the TE-Q3, the latest entry in AVIOTâ€™s Q Series, which has shipped approximately 320,000 units*1. Despite being one of the most compact active noise canceling earbuds on the market*2, the TE-Q3 offers up to 11.5 hours of playback on a single charge and up to 42 hours with the charging case. The ear tips are made from skin-friendly, medical-grade silicone*3. In addition to its robust core features, the TE-Q3 is equipped with 10 mm dynamic drivers for high-quality audio, making it a well-balanced model that excels in design, usability, and sound. *1 As of April 2025 *2 Based on the combined dimensions of all three sides of the charging case for true wireless earbuds with ANC *3 Use of medical-grade silicone does not guarantee the absence of allergic reactions in all individuals Special Voice Lines In addition to voice guidance for notifications like power and connection status, these earbuds feature a â€œrandom voiceâ€ function that plays memorable lines from the game alongside original conversations, for a total of 150 newly recorded lines. There are seven modes in totalâ€”six solo modes where each character whispers directly in your ear, and one duo mode featuring conversations between Teuta and the male characters. You can switch between them anytime via the app. Relive iconic lines from the game, brought vividly to life right by your ears! Sample voice clips will be released on the product page. Be sure to check them out! Voice line samples are available on the product page: aviot.jp/product/te-q3-bsf Special Design A deep black paired with the gold that symbolizes BUSTAFELLOWS. This chic yet glamorous color scheme is designed to evoke the nights of New Sieg. The earbuds and charging case feature the seriesâ€™ logo, creating a device that balances everyday usability with the appeal of a fan collectible.

Mekakusheâ€™s Digital Album 138-Oku Nen Me no Koi to Release on November 7! â€œZutto Emeraldâ€ Available for Early Streaming Ahead of Release!
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • Singer-songwriter mekakushe will release her digital album 138-Oku Nen Me no Koi on November 7, 2025.
  • The albumâ€™s concept is â€œthe universe.â€ Centered on tracks inspired by planets, galaxies, and cosmic imagery, it includes mekakusheâ€™s first anime tie-in: â€œRetronym of Love,â€ the ending theme of Kowloon Generic Romance, plus insert songs â€œMy Own Polarisâ€ and â€œYuwanamerou.â€ This is one of Mekakusheâ€™s most ambitious works to date.
  • To mark her birthday on July 26, she released â€œZutto Emeraldâ€ from the album for early streaming. The song blends hope and melancholy in a dreamy electro tune with a floating feel. Written and composed by mekakushe, it was arranged by Tomggg, who also worked on â€œKimi wa Snorkel.â€ The cover art and music video were created by pixel artist Nanami Yuki.
    • youtu.be/RGaXcJgGQaM

    Product Information

    Track Title: â€œZutto Emeraldâ€ Lyrics/Composition: mekakusheã€€ Arrangement: Tomggg Jacket Art: Yuki Nanami On streaming websites: linkco.re/29Fx4Qf6
    [sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]
    138-Oku Nen Me no Koi Tracklist Retronym of Love (ED theme of Kowloon Generic Romance) Zutto Emerald Kimi wa Snorkel My Own Polaris (insert song from Kowloon Generic Romance) Yuwanamerou (insert song from Kowloon Generic Romance) Sky Above And other new songs *Tracklist subject to change. Final order and content may be updated without notice.

    Mekakushe performance at ACG Hong Kong 2025

    youtube.com/shorts/fULFKxQI3SU

    Mekakusheâ€™s Comment

    â€œLove is wonderful. Iâ€™m so glad I finally realized it. Enough to wipe away everything that came before.â€ Iâ€™m honestly amazed that a day has come when I truly want to write lyrics full of hope like this. Thatâ€™s the symbolic meaning of an emerald. The 1/f fluctuationâ€”since water and music are alike, theyâ€™re both cold and warm at the same time. Tomggg arranged the sound to make it feel that way. Itâ€™s a secret that this song continues the story of â€œKimi wa Snorkel.â€

    Tomgggâ€™s Comment

    With â€œKimi wa Snorkel,â€ the music felt like floating and diving underwater. In this new song, â€œZutto Emerald,â€ you can imagine happily floating and swimming around with cute floaties. I hope the music captures the feeling of a pool of happiness and the unique sparkle of emerald, expressing all kinds of light through sound.

    Yuki Nanamiâ€™s Comment

    From the moment I first heard it, images of being gently rocked by emerald water and floating softly in space came to mind, sparking a flood of ideas that made creating the illustrations very enjoyable. Itâ€™s a soft, happy song, but with a hint of sadness that makes you want to listen to it again and again. Iâ€™m very happy to be involved in the music video. Itâ€™s been a wonderful experience!

    Tomgggâ€™s Profile

    A prolific arranger who has collaborated on projects with all kinds of artists within Japan and abroad, such as Kaho Nakamura, Chelmico, Haruno, Harmoe, Daoko, Shelheil, and Ena Mori, to name a few. His reach has since gotten even wider with the release of â€œNante neâ€ in a recent commercial for Pokari Sweat.

    Yuki Nanamiâ€™s Profile

    A pixel artist who mainly draws girls and landscapes, known for a style that captures everyday moments with a nostalgic atmosphere. She has created many video works, including music videos with looped animations, and collaborates with companies to produce and sell apparel and merchandise.

    Mekakusheâ€™s Profile

    Handling lyrics, composition, vocals, and piano performance by herself, the next-generation singer-songwriter Mekakushe enjoys immense popularity among artists and creators. Starting classical piano at the age of three, she gradually gravitated towards pop music. Her independently produced songs were featured in a Kao Laurier commercial, and she was one of the top artists on the Spotify official playlist â€œKirakira Pop Japanâ€ with a total of 3 million plays. She is a promising emerging artist with anticipated future success. With electronica as the foundation in her recordings, her musical style continues to expand, featuring classical solos and band sets in live performances. Official YouTube channel: youtube.com/@_mekakushe_ Official X: twitter.com/_mekakushe_ Official Instagram: instagram.com/_mekakushe_ Official TikTok: tiktok.com/@_mekakushe_ Official homepage: mekakushe.com

item.title: HypMic Movie Hits 2 Billion Yen Box Office Mark! â€œClaim Victory (Immersive Edition)â€ Exhibition Video Available for a Limited Time!
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • Tokyo (November 3, 2025)- The "HYPNOSISMIC -Division Rap Battle-" movie (hereafter referred to as "HypMovie") began its revival screening at 66 theaters across Japan starting September 2nd, HypMic's anniversary, to commemorate the 8th anniversary of the project's launch. With the revival, HypMovie has finally surpassed the major milestone of 2 billion yen in box office revenue.
  • HypMovie is Japan's "first" interactive movie and made its screen debut on February 21st, 2025 at 85 theaters in Japan. Due to the limited amount of interactive screening equipment, the movie continued its run at a limited number of 60 to 80 theaters in Japan. While there have been many movies in the past that started with small-scale releases of around 10 theaters, gained popularity and expanded to over 150 theaters to become major hits, HypMovie has become the first movie in Japan to surpass a box office revenue of 2 billion yen with fewer than 100 theaters from its opening day. (Source: Kogyo Tsushinsha)
  • One of the reasons the movie has been such a hit is due to its interactive nature, the first of its kind in Japan, and which plays a central role in the viewing experience. The outcome of each rap battle unfolding on the screen is decided by the audience via a specialized voting system carried out via smartphone. Viewers vote during the movie a total of 5 times to determine the winner of each battle, which means there are a total of 48 different ways the movie can play out and 7 different endings.
  • Furthermore, to commemorate the movie's success, the specially-produced video "Claim Victory (Immersive Edition)"â€”which is being shown at the "HYPNOSISMIC -Division Rap Battle-" exhibition currently in Nagoyaâ€”has been uploaded to the official Hypnosis Mic YouTube channel for a limited time.
  • The video encapsulates the intensity of the final Division Rap Battle during the movie and is a must-see for any HypMic fan. It will only be available until September 7th 23:59 JST, so don't miss it.
  • The battle continues in theaters where HypMovie continues to be shown, and audiences in Japan have the opportunity to get their hands on some limited bonus items. As the 11th round of bonuses, â€œclear cardsâ€ featuring new illustrations by the Hypnosis Mic character designer Kazui will be given out to moviegoers. 2 sets of 3 designs will be randomly distributed, the first of which is Buster Bros!!!/MAD TRIGGER CREW/Fling Posse, which will be given out until September 12th, followed by the Matenro/DOTSUITARE-HOMPO/Bad Ass Temple version from September 13th until September 19th. Both are exclusive to theaters, so if you're in the area, be sure to check out the revival screenings. For theater details, check the dedicated webpage "NOVELTY" on the official HypMovie website.
  • Additionally, part of the latest round of live HypMic events featuring HypMic cast members "HYPNOSISMIC -Division Rap Battle- 11th LIVE " (hereafter referred to as 11th Live), will be livestreamed in theaters in Japan alongside HypMovie. These special "Live Viewing" screenings will include a live broadcast of part of the stage performances before the movie screening, and will include the opening greeting from the cast on-stage.
  • Tickets for Fling Posse & Matenro's performance on September 6th are currently on sale. Tickets for MAD TRIGGER CREW & DOTSUITARE-HOMPO's performance on September 20th go on sale on September 13th, and tickets for Buster Bros!!! & Bad Ass Temple's October 4th performance goes on sale on September 27th. Check the official HypMovie website for information regarding participating theaters.
  • All 6 of the 11th Live performances will be livestreamed by ABEMA exclusively on their â€œAbema PPVâ€ platform, with tickets currently on sale. In addition to the standard ticket which will stream footage from the main camera only, a special â€œmulti-angleâ€ ticket is also on sale, which allows you to freely choose between the â€œupper cameraâ€, â€œlower cameraâ€ and â€œfull-view cameraâ€ during the stream. PPV viewers can also enjoy special bonus content: an â€œIâ€™m Homeâ€ video of the cast members recorded right after the performance, where they will talk to the camera about their thoughts and feelings directly after the show. All 6 performances can only be watched in their entirety on â€œAbema PPVâ€, so donâ€™t miss out!

    Introduction

    Music-based character rap project Hypnosis Mic: started in September 2017 Hypnosis Mic features 18 unique characters who are divided into 6 teams: Ikebukuro Division, "Ikebukuro Division," "Yokohama Division," "Shibuya Division," "Shinjuku Division," "Osaka Division," and "Nagoya Division," where they engage in intense rap battles. Leading figures in Japan's hip hop scene are featured as creators in the tracks used for each rap battle. Each character's voice actor performs all their own songs, and so each character's story develops through the music. The world of Hypnosis Mic has been explored across a range of media, including manga, video games, stage plays, anime and more, all based on its strongly characteristic music and narrative audio dramas.

    Whatâ€™s the MOVIE?

    "HYPNOSISMIC -Division Rap Battle-" is Japan's "first" audience-participation style interactive movie. The outcome of each rap battle unfolding on the screen is decided by the audience vote. Voting is conducted in real-time through the smartphone app "CtrlMovie" system by Kino Industries, and the story progresses based on the outcome of these votes. The movieâ€™s story and ending shift with each screening depending on the choices of each audience member, making each screening unique... The first-ever interactive movie experience in the history of Japanese cinema.   • The game is described as â€œa web-based adventure game that begins with a young girlâ€™s calendar.â€ The story would develop in real time until Sunday, August 31 when it reached its ending. The ending theme song was revealed at that moment as Nonoka Obuchiâ€™s â€œHachigatsu no Afterglow.â€

  • The song was written and composed by hit-maker Masayoshi Oishi. This upbeat pop song with a Japanese twist that stays true to the lively and unique world of Kakuriyo no Yadomeshi, where supernatural beings and humans dwell together and explore themes such as â€œconnectionâ€ and â€œbelonging.â€ On the other hand, the ending theme song explores the main character, Aoi Tsubakiâ€™s feelings towards her Odanna in a warm and heartfelt ballad by Tota Kasamura (LIVE LAB).
  • Additionally, a new photo of Nao Toyama pays homage to the original photo used during the initial announcement of Toyamaâ€™s tie-in with the anime seven years ago. While the photo evokes memories of the past, Nao appears to embody â€œmaturityâ€ and â€œchange.â€
  • Limited first edition copies of the single will include select recordings from Nao Toyamaâ€™s solo live concert â€œWatashi no Kangaeta Muteki na Setlist!â€ on Blu-Ray. The limited anime edition will include an original illustrated CD cover and a special variety program â€œNaoâ€™s Kitchenâ€ featuring Nao Toyama recreating the dishes served in Kakuriyo no Yadomeshi: Ni as well.

    Nao Toyama's Profile

    Birthday: March 11 Blood Type: A Hometown: Tokyo Hobbies: Singing, dancing, playing the electric organ Nao Toyama made her voice acting debut in 2010. She also belongs to popular groups Rhodanthe* and WalkÃ¼re, both of which were born in anime, and has enthralled fans with her clear voice and flawless performances. On February 1, 2017, she made her debut as a singer with â€œTrue Destiny/Chain the world,â€ tie-up songs for the anime Chain Chronicle: Haecceitas no Hikari, and on February 3, 2018, she held her first solo live at the Nippon Budokan.
