item.title: Jaleco Sports: Goal! - A Nostalgic Kick from the 8-bit and 16-bit Era
item.content:encoded:
[ad_top1 class="mb40"]
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eOhDLZ9gdEg

Most of you probably werenâ€™t even born back then, but some of us still remember what football games were like before they turned into lootbox fests catering only to online competitors. Back in the day, there were tons of different titles and approaches to the sport, and most of them had their own unique charm, offering countless hours of fun with friends and siblings. Among the standouts, the Goal! franchise was probably our favoriteâ€¦ and now itâ€™s back in full glory, with both classic games bundled into one awesome package!

Football Unites the World

Yes, thatâ€™s actually one of FIFAâ€™s recent slogans (the organization, not the video game series), and it perfectly captures one of the highlights of this new bundle. Originally developed by Tose and published by Jaleco (both Japanese companies) Goal! (known in Japan as Moero!! Pro Soccer) debuted in 1988. It was later localized for North America and Europe, with slightly different versions released in each region. Thanks to its popularity, a sequel followed in 1992, launching globally. But things werenâ€™t as straightforward as they might seemâ€¦

[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]
Because the games were released in different regions and on different consoles, there are a number of notable differencesâ€”not just in the titles, but in the content itself. For instance, the lineup of national teams varies by version. In the Japanese release of Goal!, Uruguay and the USA are not included; instead, players get Northern Ireland and Scotland. Goal! Two features even more regional variation: the Japanese version includes teams like Colombia, Ghana, and Austria, while the Western release swaps them out for Canada, Mexico, and Venezuela. Meanwhile, the USSR and West Germany are present in the NES version but were omitted from the SNES port. Fortunately, this new bundle includes all versions of both games, giving players access to every regional team, no matter where they were originally released.

A Perfect Title for Collectors!

[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

Another feature we absolutely loved is the inclusion of all the original cover art and instruction manuals. Back in the '80s and '90s, reading and re-reading those little booklets, or proudly displaying them on your shelf, was a big part of the whole video game experience. Sure, these games arenâ€™t exactly complex in terms of controls or mechanicsâ€”after all, most systems back then only had a couple of buttons to work with. In fact, most of the instructions now feel like plain common sense to todayâ€™s players. Still, having access to the original manuals feels oddly refreshing. And best of all, you can switch languages with a single button press.

And What About the Gameplay?

[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

The most notable addition to this bundle is the ability to rewind time at any moment (like in some racing games), whether itâ€™s to stop a goal from being scored, avoid a yellow or red card, or simply get a second chance after completely shanking a shot into the stratosphere. Was it necessary? Probably not. Does it feel like cheating? Absolutely, and football purists will no doubt see it as a disgrace to the sport. But hey, itâ€™s 100% optional, so no harm doneâ€¦ right? If anything, itâ€™s just a modern safety net for retro frustration.

[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

No one expects games from four decades ago to stand toe-to-toe with modern sensations like EA FC, PES, or even Rematch. But firing up a few Goal! or Goal! Two matches with friends, whether out of nostalgia or curiosity, depending on your age, can still be a blast. Sure, we donâ€™t see ourselves playing these games non-stop for days, but we genuinely enjoyed re-adapting to the punishing controls and arcade-style gameplay. Plus, there's something charming about scoring goals with national teams from countries that you donâ€™t typically find in other football games, or that donâ€™t even exist anymore. Nevertheless, if you like competing online, you can compete against other players on the monthly leaderboards!

Final Thoughts

Jaleco Sports: Goal!, the remake developed by Sickhead Games and Rock It Games, is one of those bundles weâ€™re just happy to have in our library, ready to launch now and then for a few laughs and a trip down memory lane. The game is available for Windows PC via Steam and GOG. It's been announced there will be a PlayStation 5 and Nintendo Switch release later this year.

  • Azukiâ„¢, COMISMA Inc., and Xenotoon Inc. announced a new joint anime studio â€œStudio Azukiâ€ based in the United States. The studio will develop, produce, and globally distribute original IPs and anime adaptations through unique production models shaped by the creative DNA of Azuki and its partners.
  • Originally launched as an NFT project, Azuki has been at the forefront in blending anime production with technologies and social media, while fostering collaboration between global creators and Japanese anime talents. By forming a joint venture with COMISMA and Xenotoonâ€”both of which bring strong anime production expertiseâ€”Studio Azuki aims to strengthen its creative capacity and position itself as a next-generation global anime studio.
  • Azuki has been at the forefront of the rapidly growing global anime fandom, particularly in the U.S., where enthusiasm spans general audiences, Hollywood creators, celebrities, and businesses. Studio Azuki fuses this international momentum with Japanâ€™s anime culture to pioneer new production models, elevate storytelling quality, enable fan collaboration, and introduce social-first formats that define the future of global anime.
  • Guided by its â€œAnime 2.0â€ vision, Azuki has launched several key initiatives, including the Enter The Garden anthology series, Anime.com, and being an early contributor to Animecoin Foundation. Studio Azuki will continue to explore how these platforms and blockchain technology can reshape the way anime is financed, produced, and experienced.
  • COMISMA, a founding partner of the new studio, is known for operating the manga app GANMA! and cultivating original works. It also owns the high-end animation studio Qzil.la. Xenotoon, meanwhile, brings a robust 2D/3D production pipeline and a creator-first studio network, exemplified by its collaborations with indie animators such as those behind Yasuda Gensho.
  • â€œWith a global-first, creator-centric, and social-native approach, Studio Azuki is our bold step toward building the next generation of anime, one that empowers creators, & connects directly with fans,â€ said Feb Tea, Head of Content at Azuki Labs. â€œBy joining forces with COMISMA and Xenotoon, weâ€™re combining deep, authentic anime production expertise with fresh creative energy and global perspective. Together, we can redefine how anime is developed, financed, and experienced around the world, with new original anime titles, stories and creators for years to come.â€

    • Comment From Koki Sato, CEO of COMISMA Inc.

    Iâ€™m truly excited to be part of the launch of Studio Azuki. At COMISMA, we have long been guided by our mission to make 'manga artist' a dream profession for children. Through trust in creators and strong engagement with fans, we have delivered many successful IPs to the world. With our anime studio Qzil.la focused on high-end anime, we aim to create globally beloved anime titles. I look forward to driving the industry's growth through Studio Azuki.

    Comment From Koichi Kawase, CEO of Xenotoon Inc.

    We are thrilled to announce the formation of Studio Azuki alongside such strong partners as Azuki and COMISMA. Our studio has experience across everything from social media-first short-form anime to feature-length theatrical works. From the beginning, our three companies shared a strong vision for the future of anime and entertainment. I believe it was inevitable that we would create a groundbreaking global studio together. This also marks a turning point in realizing our long-held vision to democratize the anime production, funding, and distribution pipeline. We look forward to creating a new chapter in anime history and co-creating titles that will captivate the world.

    Comment From Ko Yada, CEO of Westbrook Inc.

    At Westbrook, our mission has always been to tell stories that connect, inspire, and transcend borders. Partnering with Studio Azuki is a powerful step in that direction. Their creative vision and cultural insight align seamlessly with our global strategy. Together, weâ€™re excited to identify and develop projects that resonate deeply with audiences around the world, blending authentic storytelling with boundary-pushing innovation.

    Strategic Partnership with Westbrook Inc.

    In conjunction with the studioâ€™s formation, Studio Azuki has entered into a strategic partnership with Westbrook Inc., the global media company founded by Jada Pinkett Smith, Will Smith, Miguel Melendez, and Ko Yada, focused on empowering artists to tell stories that connect the world.. By combining Studio Azukiâ€™s production capabilities with Westbrookâ€™s deep Hollywood network and expertise in global entertainment, the partnership aims to bring next-generation anime content to audiences worldwide.

item.title: Entries Open July 1 for Round 3 of the Anime Song Choir Project â€œChoieLâ€, Now Featuring 28 Eligible Songs!
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • Bandai Namco Music Live Inc. will begin accepting entries for the third round of its anime song choir project ChoieL on July 1, 2025.
  • ChoieL is an ongoing online choir competition that was launched in August 2022, with a second round in March 2024. Round 3 brings back the 22 songs from previous editions and adds new selections from Bandai Namco Music Liveâ€™s SUNRISE MUSIC label, for a total of 28 eligible songs. As before, the contest features two categories: Full and Short.
  • Returning to the judging panel are Sohei Miyoshi (Choral Conductor / Secretary General of the Tokyo Choral Association / Planning and Supervision) and composer Tatsuya Tanaka, both of whom have served as judges since the first round.
  • Joining this round as official ambassadors is ARCANA PROJECT, an artist group from Bandai Namco Music Liveâ€™s Lantis label. A promotional video featuring the group is now available. ARCANA PROJECT will also serve as guest judges and present a new â€œARCANA PROJECT Award.â€
  • Entries will be accepted from July 1 to August 31, 2025, with both the Full and Short categories held concurrently. We look forward to your enthusiastic participation!

    • Participating Judges

    Sohei Miyoshi (Choral Conductor / Secretary General of the Tokyo Choral Association / Planning and Supervision)

    Itâ€™s been three years since ChoieL began, and thanks to your support, weâ€™re now entering our third round. The six new songs for Round 3 include titles that will resonate with an even wider range of generations than the original 22. With the addition of new arrangers, we believe this round offers more than ever for both anime song fans and choral music lovers alike. We hope ChoieL continues to be a place where you can express your passion to the fullest.

    Tatsuya Tanaka (Composer)

    The ChoieL online choir competition is now entering its third round. The full lineup of 28 songs, including the six new additions, offers an exciting and enjoyable blend of anime songs and choral music in terms of song selection, arrangement, and composition. The past two competitions were full of unforgettable moments, and weâ€™re already looking forward to seeing how participants will express themselves this time. If you have a passion for anime songs and choral music, thatâ€™s all you need to get started. We canâ€™t wait to see your entry!

    Official ChoieL Ambassadors & Judges

    ARCANA PROJECT (Lantis/Artist)

    A vocal unit consisting of Usa Sakurano, Hana Hanamiya, Shion Aida, Hikaru Amano, Yuka Shidomi, and Sakura Yoshino, co-produced by DEARSTAGE and Lantis. With a tarot card-themed group motif, they bring a diverse range of songs, including anime theme songs, to life through their distinctive vocals and performances. Comment: Weâ€™re ARCANA PROJECT, and weâ€™re honored to take part in the ChoieL anime song choir project as both official ambassadors and judges. As a group brought together by our love of anime and singing, weâ€™re truly excited to be involved in such a wonderful initiative. Through our work as ARCANA PROJECT, weâ€™ve come to feel that what matters most isnâ€™t technical skill, but the joy of singing while making eye contact, the comfort of shared breath, and the freedom to express music from the heart. Discovering your own voice and connecting with others through song are deeply meaningful and precious experiences. We hope this project brings those same experiences to many people. We canâ€™t wait to hear your voices. https://youtu.be/ivBlGhJhfPc

    About ChoieL

    The anime song choir project â€œChoieLâ€ was launched on June 1, 2022, with the aim of bringing together the beloved tradition of choir and the world of anime songs. Our goal is to draw out new charms from each, aspiring to a future where anime songs are loved as standard numbers in the choir world. As the first step of this project, we hosted our first online choir competition in August 2022, and 50 groups participated to showcase the fresh appeal of anime songs. Starting from the second online competition, the project has expanded to include sustainable activities that utilize the intellectual property of anime songs to deliver free music events to young people and fans worldwide. ChoieL Official Website: project-choiel.jp ChoieL Official X (formerly Twitter): twitter.com/Project_ChoieL ChoieL Official Instagram: instagram.com/project_choiel

    Overview of Anime Song Choir Project ChoieL Third Online Competition

    Organizers: Bandai Namco Music Live Inc. Supporter: Tokyo Choral Association Period: July 1, 2025 - August 31, 2025 *The Full and Short Divisions will run concurrently. Judges: Sohei Miyoshi (Choral Conductor / Secretary General of the Tokyo Choral Association / Planning and Supervision) Tatsuya Tanaka (Composer) Bandai Namco Music Live Official Ambassador: ARCANA PROJECT (Lantis/Artist) Entry Fee: There is no entry fee. However, sheet music must be purchased for each participant. Eligibility for Participation: *Applies to all divisions ãƒ»Please purchase the electronic sheet music of the song you would like to perform from L SCORE, the official music brand of Namco Bandai Music Live. ãƒ»The same choir may participate in both the short and full divisions. ãƒ»Multiple song entries are acceptable. (However, only one song per submission). ãƒ»A conductor is not required. ãƒ»Please play the accompaniment as specified in the score, or download the accompaniment soundtrack from the official website. ãƒ»In addition to regular choirs, virtual choirs can also be created by combining individual performances or multiple recordings by a single person. *There is no need to apply for the use of music for this competition. Benefits: Each winning group will receive a commemorative trophy and ChoieL original merchandise for all participants. The grand prize winner will also get to experience recording their choir performance in a professional studio and will receive the final audio recording.

    Eligible Songs (Total of 28 Songs)

    "Rhapsody of Blue Sky", TV anime Miss Kobayashiâ€™s Dragon Maid. Mixed choir, composed by Yuka Yamashita. "Kimi no Kokoro wa Kagayaiteru kai?", Love Live! Sunshine!!. Mixed choir, composed by Chieko Matsunami. "Can Do", TV anime Kurokoâ€™s Basketball. Mixed choir, composed by Noritaka Moriyama. "Thank You!", The Idolm@ster Million Live!. Mixed choir, composed by Ayako Meida. "SKILL", 2nd Super Robot Wars Alpha. Mixed choir, composed by Noritaka Moriyama. "Spread the Wings!!", The Idolmaster: Shiny Colors. Mixed choir, composed by Masaya Ishiwaka. "TOKIMEKI Runners", Love Live! School Idol Festival ALL STARS. Mixed choir, composed by Tomoaki Yokoyama. "DRIVE A LIVE", The Idolmaster: SideM. Mixed choir, composed by Naoto Aizawa. "DREAM SOLISTER", TV anime Sound! Euphonium. Mixed choir, composed by Tatsuya Tanaka. "Bokura no LIVE Kimi to no LIFE", Love Live!. Mixed choir, composed by Tatsuya Tanaka. "Motteke! Sailor Fuku", TV anime Lucky Star. Mixed choir, composed by Tatsuya Tanaka. "MONSTER GENERATiON", Idolish7. Mixed choir, composed by Chieko Matsunami. "Yasashisa no Riyuu", TV anime Hyouka. Mixed choir, composed by Toyotaka Tsuchida. "Violet Snow", TV anime Violet Evergarden. Female choir, composed by Naoto Aizawa. "STARDOM!", TV anime Data Carddass Aikatsu Stars!. Female choir, composed by Tatsuya Tanaka. "Hajimari wa Kimi no Sora", Love Live! Superstar!!. Female choir, composed by Kaori Morita. "Hana no Iro", TV anime Hanasaku Iroha. Female choir, composed by Noritaka Moriyama. "Caste Room", TV anime Classroom of the Elite. Male choir, composed by Noritaka Moriyama. "Dramatic", Ultraman Taiga The Movie. Male choir, composed by Noboru Kitagawa. "Namae wo Yobu yo", TV anime Bungo Stray Dogs. Unaccompanied male choir, composed by Noboru Kitagawa. "Hare Hare Yukai", TV anime The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya. Mixed voice acapella, composed by Chizuru Matsunaga. "Broadcast Parade". Mixed voice acapella, composed by Inhyeok Yeo. "Soldiers of Sorrow", Mobile Suit Gundam II: Soldiers of Sorrow. Male choir, composed by Tatsuya Tanaka. For other details, such as participation rules and regulations, please refer to the official website (project-choiel.jp). The scores of all 28 eligible songs are now available on L SCORE, the official music brand of Namco Bandai Music Live! L SCORE official website: lscore.jp â˜…Videos of all 28 eligible songs are now available on YouTube. youtube.com/playlist?list=PLmgGL3shzkGPIOiTzDqo16yOT96SXPv4F

    About ChoieLâ€™s Sustainable Activities

    Starting from the second online competition, the anime song choir project ChoieL will be carried out as part of the sustainable activities of Bandai Namco Music Live. The Bandai Namco Group has defined its Purpose as â€œFun for All into the Future.â€ Under our IP strategy, the group, along with its fans, will promote sustainable activities to address societal issues. In line with our long term plan, which advocates for sustainability under the theme of â€œconnecting smiles to the future,â€ we have identified five material issues and are actively working to resolve them. In the anime song choir project ChoieL, we aim to utilize our intellectual property of anime songs to deliver free music events to young people and fans worldwide. To continue being a company cherished by communities and fans, and recognized as essential by society, Bandai Namco Music Live will continue to engage in sustainable activities in the future. Global Search for the Next Isekai Hit Begins July 7: â€œMyAnimeList x Honeyfeed Writing Contest 2025 - THE ISEKAI presented by KADOKAWAâ€ Launches Worldwide!
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="Illustration by Seira Minami" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • KADOKAWA CORPORATION will co-host the novel contest, "MyAnimeList x Honeyfeed Writing Contest 2025 - THE ISEKAI presented by KADOKAWA," in partnership with qdopp Inc. and MyAnimeList Co., Ltd. The contest will be held on Honeyfeed, a novel submission platform operated by qdopp, with the goal of discovering exceptional storytelling talent from around the world.
  • This contest aims to discover fresh talent who can craft stories with the potential to stand alongside industry-defining titles like Overlord, Re:ZERO -Starting Life in Another World-, The Rising of the Shield Hero, Mushoku Tensei: Jobless Reincarnation and Sword Art Online. As an added bonus, the contest features a special guest in the jury panel: Aneko Yusagi, writer of The Rising of the Shield Hero. Winners even receive personalized feedback from this renowned and experienced Isekai author, an incredible chance to gain insight directly from one of the most successful storytellers in the genre.

    • Comment From Satoshi Arima, Project Manager and Editor in Chief of MF BOOKS

    In recent years, Japanese anime has seen a surge in global popularity. Many of these popular anime titles originate from light novels. At KADOKAWA, we are constantly seeking new talent to create the next big hit. Amid this trend, an increasing number of stories styled after Japanese light novels are being posted on overseas novel submission platforms. These platforms are emerging as hubs for content and creators with the potential to achieve widespread success not only in Japan but around the world. In response to this global trend, KADOKAWA has launched the Global UGC Publishing Project as part of its Global Business Acceleration Program, which supports new business ventures targeting international markets. This project aims to discover global talent through overseas novel platforms and bring â€œinternationally-bornâ€ light novels to audiences both in Japan and worldwide. The MyAnimeList x Honeyfeed Writing Contest 2025 â€“ THE ISEKAI presented by KADOKAWA marks the first step in this initiative. Moving forward, the project will expand through initiatives such as a Traditional Chinese writing contest hosted on KadoKado - the novel serialization platform operated by KADOKAWA TAIWAN CORPORATION - as well as the publication of selected winning titles from the JNC Original Light Novel Contest organized by M12 Media LLC.

    Contest Information

    Entry fee: Free Writing platform: Honeyfeed Voting platform: MyAnimeList Novel entry period: July 7 to September 29, 2025 Judges voting period: September 30 to November 16, 2025 Public voting period (Finals): November 17 to December 15, 2025 Winners announced: February 9, 2026

    Prizes

    Grand Prize â€” $5,000 USD Winners: 1 Your novel will be scheduled for publication by KADOKAWA in Japan as a light novel, subject to KADOKAWAâ€™s final approval. Important: The Grand Prize may not be awarded if no submission meets the standards for publication. Contest Winners Prize â€” $3,000 USD Winners: 2 winners; or 3 if no Grand Prize is selected You might be offered publication of your novel in Japanese by KADOKAWA in Japan as a light novel. For complete contest details, submission guidelines, and updates, visit mhwc.myanimelist.net/202507.

    About KADOKAWA CORPORATION

    KADOKAWA Group, a comprehensive entertainment company, develops a wide range of businesses such as Publication, Animation, Film, Gaming, Web services, and Education/EdTech. We discover talent globally, create diverse IP (Intellectual property), and deliver it through various media. We maximize the value of IP under our strategy â€œGlobal Media Mix with Technologyâ€ which refers to global rollouts of created IP by utilizing technology. Please visit group.kadokawa.co.jp/global,

    About Honeyfeed

    Honeyfeed is a leading writing platform that empowers authors to create, share, and engage with their original stories. With a vibrant community of readers and writers, Honeyfeed provides an immersive space for storytelling across various genres, including anime and manga-inspired narratives. For more about Honeyfeed, please visit honeyfeed.fm.

    About MyAnimeList (MAL)

    MyAnimeList is one of the worldâ€™s largest communities and databases for Japanese anime and manga, with 16 million registered members from 240 countries and regions worldwide. An indispensable site for tracking anime and manga progress, it holds over 1.2 billion records of viewing and reading big data. Founded in 2004, MyAnimeList has become a crucial source of information for overseas fans, especially among Generation Z in North America. For more about MyAnimeList, please visit myanimelist.net.

item.title: ARCANA PROJECT Releases Digital Single â€œKimi no Ichioshi Arimasu ka? / Ruby Rubyâ€
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • ARCANA PROJECT, known for performing theme songs for popular titles such as The Aquatope on White Sand and Ultraman Arc, released their new digital single â€œKimi no Ichioshi Arimasu ka? / Ruby Rubyâ€ on June 23.
  • These two tracks serve as the second set of image songs for LINK TRAVELERS, Bandaiâ€™s new IP that launched through â€œshokuganâ€ (candy) and â€œgashaponâ€ (capsule toys) in May 2025.
  • â€œKimi no Ichioshi Arimasu ka?â€ is a classic idol anthem in the current trend, perfect for energizing a live crowd. In contrast, â€œRuby Rubyâ€ offers a nostalgic idol vibe with a fresh, uplifting melody. Both songs have been released in two editions: a Short Size used within the LINK TRAVELERS project, and a Full Size performed by all six members.
    • https://youtu.be/NhFv_0DWhKY

    Product Information

    Digital Single â€œKimi no Ichioshi Arimasu ka? / Ruby Rubyâ€ On music services: lnk.to/LZC-3148 Tracklist 1. Kimi no Ichioshi Arimasu ka (Short Size) Artist: ARCANA PROJECT (Usa Sakurano, Hana Hanamiya, Shion Aida, Hikaru Amano) Lyrics, Composition, Arrangement: Shinji Suzuki (KEYTONE) 2. Ruby Ruby (Short Size) Artist: ARCANA PROJECT (Shion Aida, Hikaru Amano) Lyrics: Futa Shintani; Composition, Arrangement: Takaaki Kimura (KEYTONE) 3. Kimi no Ichioshi Arimasu ka Artist: ARCANA PROJECT 4. Ruby Ruby Artist: ARCANA PROJECT

  • Kowloon Generic Romance is a hugely popular mystery-romance anime based on Jun Mayuzuki (of After the Rain fame)â€™s latest work, which has sold more than 1.5 million copies.
  • Following the ending theme â€œRetronym of Loveâ€ and the Episode 7 insert song â€œWatashi Dake no Polaris,â€ this marks the third mekakushe track featured in the series.
  • â€œYuwanamerouâ€ was written and composed by mekakushe, with arrangement by Ryohei Sataka (Hifumi, inc.), who also handled the seriesâ€™ score. The result is a wistful pop song that delicately expresses the complexity of a womanâ€™s hidden emotions.

    • Product Information

    Digital Single mekakushe â€œYuwanamerouâ€ Lyrics/Composition: mekakusheã€€ Arrangement: Ryohei Sakata (Hifumi Inc.) On streaming websites: linkco.re/BQGVYe3c Official audio: youtu.be/k-4W-ea1bnM

    Mekakusheâ€™s Comment

    To me, love is like the auroraâ€”like a mirage, it shines beautifully because itâ€™s born from loneliness. When I imagined the moment of meeting someone, it felt like a rush of heat sweeping through my heart, creating an aurora. It was something like a solar flare. That feeling is what inspired me as I wrote â€œYuwanamerou.â€

    Mekakusheâ€™s Profile

    Handling lyrics, composition, vocals, and piano performance by herself, the next-generation singer-songwriter Mekakushe enjoys immense popularity among artists and creators. Starting classical piano at the age of three, she gradually gravitated towards pop music. Her independently produced songs were featured in a Kao Laurier commercial, and she was one of the top artists on the Spotify official playlist â€œKirakira Pop Japanâ€ with a total of 3 million plays. She is a promising emerging artist with anticipated future success. With electronica as the foundation in her recordings, her musical style continues to expand, featuring classical solos and band sets in live performances.   • AVIOT, operated by Preseed Japan Corporation, which manufactures and sells consumer electronics, is launching its 2025 Spring/Summer Promo Tour with appearances at anime conventions across the United States. At each event, AVIOT will showcase and sell character voice earbuds and collaboration merchandise.

    • About Character Voice Earbuds

    AVIOTâ€™s character voice earbuds are special-edition models created in collaboration with anime, VTubers, and voice actors. Each pair features exclusive designs, packaging, and voice guidance recorded by the featured cast, providing voice prompts for functions like power and battery status. They also include a â€œRandom Voiceâ€ feature, which lets you enjoy iconic lines or exclusive phrases only available through the earbuds. Simply touch and hold the right earbud to hear surprise voice clips at any time. Most models offer multiple voice modes, which can be easily switched via the companion app, allowing you to enjoy different characters or personalities with a single pair. Sound tuning is supervised by the original artists or voice actors to capture each titleâ€™s unique atmosphere. Select models also include specially drawn artwork*, designed with close attention to detail to reflect the world of your favorite character. *Sound tuning and special artwork may not be available for all models. In addition to fan-focused features, these earbuds also offer high-end specs such as noise cancellation and long battery life, making them a great choice for everyday use. Several collaboration models are based on the TE-V1R, a high-spec base model that has received multiple awards, including the PCMag Excellence Award.

    Exhibition Schedule

    AVIOT will appear at five anime conventions across five North American cities from April to August 2025, as outlined below: April 18â€“20: Sakura-Con (Completed) May 21â€“23: Anime Boston (Completed) June 19â€“21: OffKai EXPO July 3â€“6: Anime Expo August 23â€“25: Anime NYC At each convention, AVIOT will exhibit and sell collaboration earbuds and merchandise created in partnership with a variety of IPs, including anime, games, and VTubers. In addition, exclusive displays will showcase upcoming collaboration models currently available for pre-order, giving you a chance to experience them before anyone else!   • TOMY Company will exhibit at Anime Expo 2025 (AX2025), North Americaâ€™s largest anime and manga convention, held in Los Angeles from July 3 to 6. The company will operate three exhibits, each dedicated to a different brand: the BEYBLADE X series, the modern version of â€œbei-gomaâ€ spinning tops; T-SPARK, a hobby label for high-end customers; and the GachaÂ® capsule toy brand, distributed by T-ARTS Company,Ltd.
  • At the BEYBLADE X booth, the U.S. Open Class of the BEYBLADE X National Tournament will be held on July 5. The winner will qualify for the BEYBLADE X WORLD CHAMPIONSHIP 2025, scheduled for October in Japan, the birthplace of BEYBLADE.
  • This will mark the second consecutive year that BEYBLADE X is featured at the event, while T-SPARK and Gacha will make their debut appearances. Through these exhibits, TOMY Group will continue to share the excitement of play with fans around the world.

    • About BEYBLADE

    â€œBEYBLADEâ€ battling tops, debuted in 1999, are a modernized version of traditional Japanese battling tops known as â€œbei-goma.â€ Over 520 million units have been shipped cumulatively in more than 80 countries and regions around the world (as of April 2023). Each series has created a craze in many countries across the world including Japan. The fourth generation, BEYBLADE X started in July 2023 in Japan.

    Highlights of BEYBLADE X booth

    â†’ The U.S. Open Class (ages 13 and up) of the BEYBLADE X National Tournament will be held to determine the top blader who will advance to the BEYBLADE X WORLD CHAMPIONSHIP 2025. â†’ Visitors can enjoy a free-play area and showcases of upcoming products.     â€œT-SPARKâ€ is the unified brand for hobby products for adults developed by TOMY Company, symbolizing innovation and sophisticated adventure. Leveraging TOMY Companyâ€™s expertise in â€œtransformation,â€ â€œcombinationâ€ and â€œarticulationâ€ â€• the features that have attracted hobby lovers â€• T-SPARK offers a diverse and engaging hobby experience. Some of the T-SPARK products are available through the official North American Online store â€œTOMY PLUSâ€ (us.tomy.com/brand/tomy-plus) operated by TOMY International, Inc. Product Details: Q VILLAGE, COLLEKAZARO, SPARK Fig takaratomy.co.jp/english/product_release/pdf/p250528_en.pdf https://youtu.be/4xrQvyHJjik

item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • SANDA is a manga by Paru Itagaki, creator of BEASTARS, which won the Grand Prize at the 2018 Manga Taisho along with three other major manga awards. Set in a near-future Japan where extreme measures are taken to protect children amid a drastic population decline, the story depicts an unconventional Santa Claus hero in an action-packed tale. The anime adaptation is produced by Science SARU, the studio behind DAN DA DAN and Scott Pilgrim Takes Off. It is set to premiere in Japan on October 3, 2025, with a world premiere also confirmed for Anime Expo.
  • Alongside the broadcast date announcement, the second teaser trailer has been released. It showcases a world shaped by extreme overprotection amid a super-declining birthrate, focusing on the classmates of protagonist Kazushige Sanda (voiced by Ayumu Murase) at Daikoku Welfare Academy. How is Santa Claus treated in a Japan where children have almost disappeared? And how will Sandaâ€™s interactions with classmates like Fuyumura develop? Stay tuned for more updates!
  • New Characters and Voice Cast Revealed, with Comments! Alongside the release of Teaser PV #2, several new characters have been revealed! Umeka Shoji voices Shiori Fuyumura, who discovers Sandaâ€™s identity and sets out to save her missing best friend. Her friend Ichie Ono is played by Anna Nagase. Yuuki Shin voices Hitoshi Amaya, Sandaâ€™s roommate, and Misato Matsuoka plays Nico Kazao, Sandaâ€™s fiancÃ©e. Comments from the cast have also been released!
  • https://youtu.be/X2VRYMWbaes

    SANDA Joins Anime Expo!

    SANDA will be featured at Anime Expo 2025, North Americaâ€™s largest anime and Japanese pop culture event, held at the Los Angeles Convention Center from July 3 to 6. On July 4, a world premiere event will take place, with author Paru Itagaki, director Tomohisa Shimoyama, and Science SARU producer Kohei Sakita in attendance. The event will include a live drawing session by Itagaki and a screening of Episode 1 of the SANDA anime. For more information, please check Anime Expoâ€™s official social media channels.

    Anime Expo 2025 Overview

    Dates: July 3 (Thu) â€“ July 6 (Sun), 2025 Venue: Los Angeles Convention Center Official Website: anime-expo.org Official X: x.com/animeexpo Official Instagram: instagram.com/animeexpo Official Facebook: facebook.com/animeexpo

    SANDA event at Anime Expo 2025

    Date: July 4 (Fri) Time: 12:30 PM â€“ 1:50 PM Location: JW Platinum Ballroom Panelists: Paru Itagaki (author), Tomohisa Shimoyama (director), Kohei Sakita (producer) The event will include: ãƒ»Live drawing by Paru Itagaki ãƒ»World premiere of the first episode of the TV anime SANDA ãƒ»Commentary on highlighted scenes from episode #1 and discussion ãƒ»Q&A with the panelists ãƒ»Comment video by Ayumu Murase (who plays Sanda) ãƒ»Free give away for visitors: SANDA Towel (Tenugui style) Official X (formerly Twitter): x.com/sanda_anime Official Website: sanda.red
    [sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

    Voice Cast of Sandaâ€™s Classmates Revealed!

    Shiori Fuyumura (Voiced by Umeka Shoji)

    A 14-year-old classmate of Sanda who stands over 182 cm tall. She seeks help from Santa Claus to find her friend Ono, who suddenly went missing. To break the curse and revive the sealed Santa, she threatens Sanda with a deadly blade. Comment 1. How did you feel when you were cast as Fuyumura in SANDA? And what message do you have for fans looking forward to the series? Meeting Shiori Fuyumura during the audition was such a powerful experience that it feels like sheâ€™s become a constant presence in my life. I poured everything I have into this role. Iâ€™d be thrilled if SANDA reaches a wide audience. 2. Since this is an action series featuring Santa Claus, is there anything youâ€™d want to ask him for? A liver so strong that it can handle any alcohol.

    Ichie Ono (Voiced by Anna Nagase)

    A classmate of Sanda and best friend of Fuyumura. She suddenly disappeared from their class, and her whereabouts remain unknown. The school considers her dead, but Fuyumura is determined to search for her with Santa Clausâ€™ help. Comment 1. How did you feel when you were cast as Ono in SANDA? And what message do you have for fans looking forward to the series? Ono was a role that really challenged me. I struggled a lot while developing the character, and I constantly felt a sense of anxiety and tightness in my chest. I hope that feeling comes through in Onoâ€™s portrayal. Please look forward to the broadcast! 2. Since this is an action series featuring Santa Claus, is there anything youâ€™d want to ask him for? When I was a kid, I was always the one receiving presents, so this time, Iâ€™d like to give something back. Maybe I could help out? Like riding in the sleigh with Santa and delivering presents around town! That sounds like fun.

    Hitoshi Amaya (Voiced by Yuuki Shin)

    Sandaâ€™s roommate, also known as â€œPrince Amaya.â€ He is one of the few who know Santa Clausâ€™ secret and wants him to return to fulfill an important wish. Comment 1. How did you feel when you were cast as Amaya in SANDA? And what message do you have for fans looking forward to the series? Iâ€™m really excited to be voicing Amaya in SANDA. I enjoyed bringing out his mysterious charm through my performance. This story really makes you reflect on what it means to be an adult. Itâ€™s a wonderful series, so please be sure to watch it! 2. Since this is an action series featuring Santa Claus, is there anything youâ€™d want to ask him for? Iâ€™d love to ask Santa Claus for a Nintendo Switch 2. Even if I donâ€™t get one, just a chance to win the pre-order lottery would be great. Iâ€™ve been good, so please! Iâ€™d like to play racing games on it!

    Nico Kazao (Voiced by Misato Matsuoka)

    Sandaâ€™s fiancÃ©e, chosen by the country from birth. Sheâ€™s a realist who wants to rebel a little before becoming a â€œresponsible adult.â€ She always acts freely and often swears. Comment 1. How did you feel when you were cast as Nico in SANDA? And what message do you have for fans looking forward to the series? When I first learned about Nico, I was deeply captivated by her complete freedom from any constraints. She might be someone who truly understands the preciousness of the present moment. Iâ€™m genuinely happy to be able to bring her to life! Please watch as these lovable characters struggle and grow together. I poured my heart into this role and had a great time. Thank you for your support! 2. Since this is an action series featuring Santa Claus, is there anything youâ€™d want to ask him for? I love eggplant, so Iâ€™d want lots of dishes like deep-fried eggplant soaked in light dashi and mapo eggplant!

item.title: [Honey's Anime Interview] Celebrating TRUE's 10th Anniversary!
item.content:encoded:
Miho Karasawa, who also goes by the stage name TRUE, has just released her 10th anniversary album titled "TRUE the BEST" on February 26 (her debut date)! You may know her for her passionate vocal style and straightforward lyrics in theme songs for anime series like Buddy Complex, Gargantia on the Verdurous Planet, Maria the Virgin Witch, Sound! Euphonium, and many others. Although she has been active as an artist since 2000, she debuted under the name TRUE in 2014, quickly becoming a powerhouse singer, flawlessly performing numerous opening and ending themes each anime season. We had the lovely opportunity to interview TRUE once more, to talk about the future and reflect on these ten years full of hits and challenges.

TRUE
Honey-Chan
Interview with TRUE
[gray-hex-decoration]
Itâ€™s been a year since our last conversation, and we're so happy to be chatting with you again! So, you recently released an anniversary album, packed with 30 songs and numerous hits. Was it challenging to select and arrange the tracks for this album? And if you had to choose, which song would you say is your favorite?
This release includes singles, lead tracks from albums, and key songs that represent my musical journey over the past ten years. With the exception of the first and last tracks, the songs are arranged in the order they were released. It starts with the first track, â€œTRUE,â€ and ends with â€œDelighT,â€ with the capital T at the end representing the T in TRUE. I wanted it to begin and end with TRUE, which is how the tracklist took shape. Every song holds a special meaning to me, so itâ€™s hard to pick just one favorite.
The Limited First Edition includes a Blu-ray featuring two performances: TRUE Live Sound! vol.6 Encount, held at NHK Hall, and Sayonara Nakano Sunplaza Music Festival: TRUE Live Sound! vol.7 Ensemble, held at Nakano Sunplaza, both from 2023. Can you share any memorable anecdotes or special moments from these performances?
For me, live performances are life itself. Iâ€™m truly grateful to have these moments recorded. I hope that even those who couldnâ€™t be there can still feel the passion of the shows through the Blu-ray.
https://youtu.be/x6fUsfL8UKw
And how about your most recent live event, TRUE 10th Anniversary Live Sound! Final Shuutaisei at Zepp DiverCity this January? How was that experience?
That show was the perfect way to wrap up my 10th anniversary. It was my first time performing in a large live house, and the audienceâ€™s energy was even greater than I had imagined. I felt that it was a meaningful milestone not just for me, but for the fans as well, marking the end of a decade. Throughout the anniversary year, I held various types of live shows, and I plan to use what I gained from those experiences moving forward.
Now it's time to celebrate your first decade as an artist, but given everything you've accomplished so far, we imagine you're already planning your next steps. Are you currently working on any new songs or projects to be released soon?
Yes, Iâ€™m trying various new things and plan to put even more effort into live performances both in Japan and overseas. Since last year, Iâ€™ve been doing joint live shows with other artists, and through these interactions, Iâ€™m working to expand my musical range. Another goal for the future is to create a theme song for a tokusatsu anime. I will continue my music activities, dreaming of the day that wish comes true.
In May, you performed three new shows in Japan as part of your TRUE Live Tour PLAY! vol.1 -ReCoda-. How did you prepare for these events?
This time, I did my very first hall tour. I felt like I received so many gifts and warm congratulations for my 10th anniversary, and so many people came out to celebrate with me at my shows. Iâ€™m going to use all that support as fuel to make each live performance a success from this 11th year onward, which will help me grow even more. Itâ€™s not exactly going back to my roots, but Iâ€™m planning to perform with the same band lineup as my very first live, carefully arranging each song to deliver it thoughtfully. In June, Iâ€™m also holding my first-ever Asia tour. Itâ€™s a new challenge to see how much I can convey beyond borders and language barriers. Iâ€™ll do my best!
We'll be looking forward to this! And to close our interview, could you share a message for our readers, many of whom have followed our previous interviews and are passionate about your music?
Thank you always for your support. Iâ€™m truly grateful to receive encouragement from people in many countries through social media. Your words keep me motivated. From now on, as an anisong singer, I will continue doing my best to share Japanese anime culture and anisong culture with all of you. I look forward to the day we can meet someday.
We've been listening to this new album since release day, and it brings back so many memories! At Honeyâ€™s Anime, weâ€™re deeply passionate about TRUEâ€™s music and have had the pleasure of witnessing her incredible growth over the years. If youâ€™re new to her work and eager to discover more, be sure to check her out on social media.
Connect with TRUE Streaming link: lnk.to/LACM-24407d Official Site: true-singer.com/ X (Twitter): x.com/miho_karasawa Instagram: instagram.com/miho_karasawa YouTube channel: youtube.com/@TRUEOfficialChannel

item.title: Japanese Traditional Craft x The Ghost in the Shell: â€œTechnoByobu: TB-02â€ â€” An Art Piece That Transcends Time and Space Coming in 2026 from U/M/A/A
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • U/M/A/A has announced that it will release a second installment of â€œTechnoByobu,â€ an art piece that combines the spirit of techno with the traditional Japanese craft of folding screens, in 2026. This new series, titled â€œTB-02: The Ghost in the Shell,â€ is based on Shirow Masamuneâ€™s legendary cyberpunk series The Ghost in the Shell.
  • â€œTechnoByobuâ€ is an art piece of a new era that reimagines the works of internationally and domestically acclaimed artists as folding screens made from wafer-thin golden brass leaves, a craft that has been handed down in Japan for over 500 years. The artworks, vividly depicted in vibrant colors on folding screens made entirely of golden brass leaf, have attracted attention as a fusion of traditional and modern art. The first piece, â€œTB-01: Electronic Fan Girl,â€ which was inspired by the album artwork of YMO (Yellow Magic Orchestra), generated significant buzz.
  • â€œTB-02: The Ghost in the Shell,â€ based on the world-famous science fiction work The Ghost in the Shell (Shirow Masamune/Kodansha), utilizes the physical medium of a folding screen with cybernetic visuals, creating a next-generation visual that merges past and future.
  • Scheduled for release in 2026 as part of a series themed around traditional Japanese elegance, the first work in the series boldly features Motoko Kusanagi and the Fuchikoma from Shirow Masamuneâ€™s original 1991 manga, on a golden brass leaf background.
  • Prior to the release, U/M/A/A will unveil the first prototype of the series at Design Shanghai 2025 (designshanghai.com) to be held in Shanghai, China, from June 4, 2025.

    • TechnoByobu Second Installment TB-02: The Ghost in the Shell

    ï¸TechnoByobu Second Installment

    Number: TB-02 Title: The Ghost in the Shell Artist: Shirow Masamune

    Product Overview

    TechnoByobu Official Website: technobyobu.jp Release Date: Scheduled for 2026 This piece will be offered as a limited edition, accompanied by a unique serial number. If you are considering a purchase, please register through the Customer Service form on the official website. Priority information will be sent to registered customers. Customer Service form: technobyobu.jp/cs Size: Height: 59.05 inches (1,500 mm) Width: 55.12 inches (1,400 mm) Weight: 8.8 pounds (4 kg) Material: Golden Brass Leaf Printing Method: Archival Pigment Print Technique: Kasane Graphica Multi-Layered Pigment Transfer Technique Price: TBD Series Concept: A lineup of distinct pieces infused with the elegance and spirit of Japan.

    What is TechnoByobu?

    TechnoByobuâ€™s â€œtechnoâ€ originates from the Greek word tÃ©chnÄ“, meaning art, technique, or skill. It embodies more than just practical know-how; itâ€™s a philosophical concept that encompasses the intelligence and creativity behind craftsmanship, as well as the futuristic expression of electronic music. Rooted in this background, â€œtechnoâ€ is not only the origin of the word â€œtechnologyâ€ but also a layered term that blends cultural and artistic innovation. Based on this philosophy, TechnoByobu is composed of three elements: ãƒ»Artwork that evokes futurism (art) ãƒ»Byobu (folding screens), a traditional Japanese craft kept alive by artisans (skill) ãƒ»Digital certificates guaranteed by technology (technique) By overlapping these elements, TechnoByobu culminates as an art piece that expresses the multifaceted nature of â€œTechno.â€ Moving forward, it will continue to explore new possibilities of expression in collaboration with diverse talents both in Japan and abroad.

    About The Ghost in the Shell

    â€œThe Ghost in the Shellâ€ is a science fiction manga series written by manga artist Shirow Masamune, which began serialization in 1989, in Kodanshaâ€™s â€œYoung Magazine Pirate Edition.â€ The story revolves around Motoko Kusanagi, a full-body cyborg with exceptional skill in both cyber and conventional warfare. With the rank of Major, she leads the aggressive unit â€œShell Squadâ€ as they confront highly intricate and sinister crimes. With its realistic art style, the seriesâ€™ narrative explores the fusion of humans and technology, delving into cyberpunk elements and philosophical themes, while deeply examining topics such as personal identity. The series has been expanded into various forms including theatrical and TV animations, as well as games. Each of these adaptations offers its own unique story, interpretations, and expressions, distinct from the original manga.

    Unveiling of the prototype at Design Shanghai â€” the Worldâ€™s First Public Exhibition

    Design Shanghai is one of the worldâ€™s most prestigious international design events and a driving force in the new frontier-breaking Chinese design world. In 2024, they invited more than 600 brands from 40 countries worldwide to exhibit new products and hold specially organized events. At this yearâ€™s 2025 Design Shanghai, starting June 4, TechnoByobuâ€™s second installment, â€œTB-02: The Ghost in the Shell,â€ will be unveiled to the world for the very first time. During the exhibition, visitors will have the opportunity to see the prototype up close.
    [sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

    Exhibition Information

    Design Shanghai 2025 Date: June 4th-7th, 2025 Venue: Shanghai Expo Hall 3 â€œBeyond Craft Japanâ€ 3F81 designshanghai.com

    About Rekiseisha

    In its founding year of 1905, Rekiseisha developed a groundbreaking scientific technique that had never been seen before: foil-pressed paper using brass leaf that was just as beautiful as the traditional gold foil (hon-kinpaku) but far more resistant to discoloration over time. This innovative manufacturing method has earned Rekiseisha international acclaim, with its foil products used not only by the Imperial Hotel, the Imperial Household Agency, and Nishi Honganji Temple, but also by global luxury brands such as CHANEL and GUCCI.     About U/M/A/A Inc. (United Music And Arts) (Planning, Production, Sales)

    U/M/A/A Inc. is a next-generation record label dedicated to bridging music and artâ€”including media art, fashion, anime, games, manga, and technologyâ€”across Japan and the rest of the world. The label curates and delivers high-quality music that spans a wide range of genres, from club and electronic music to internet-driven styles such as Vocaloid and anime songs. Founded by Masakazu â€œHiroâ€ Hiroishiâ€”formerly of the legendary Alfa Records, the company that brought Yellow Magic Orchestra (YMO) to global prominence in the late 1970sâ€”U/M/A/A Inc. was established with the mission of carrying forward YMOâ€™s pioneering spirit and the innovation of techno-pop into the modern age. In that spirit, U/M/A/A Inc. presents TechnoByobuâ€”a project that embodies the fusion of tradition, technology, and art. Contact: U/M/A/A Inc. info@technobyobu.jp umaa.net

item.title: [Honey's Anime Interview] nano.RIPE Talks New Album, Tour, and Over 20 Years of Music
item.content:encoded:
After over two decades in the industry, Japanese duo nano.RIPE continues to shine. Their latest full album, Hikari wo Hakobumono (â€œThose Who Carry Lightâ€), was released on March 12, and features 13 tracksâ€”including 10 brand-new songsâ€”built around the theme of â€œinitial impulses.â€ Even after 15 years since their debut, nano.RIPE remains driven by the same spark that first inspired them to create music. In this exclusive interview, we catch up with nano.RIPE to talk about the albumâ€™s creative process, their evolution as a band, and how theyâ€™ve kept their passion alive through the years.

nano.RIPE
Honey-Chan
Interview with nano.RIPE
[gray-hex-decoration]
After a 2-year break, you've just released your 8th full album, Hikari wo Hakobumono. How do you feel about it, and what was the creative process like?
During the two and a half years since our last album, we continued making songs and releasing singles. So rather than beginning from a single burst of inspiration, this album consists of 10 tracks carefully selected from songs we created in that period, older pieces, and brand-new ones written specifically for this release. We believe weâ€™ve put together a really strong album this time.
And to promote this new release, you will be touring Japan from April to June. What can your fans expect from these shows?
This tour mainly features songs from the album, but weâ€™re mixing in popular live tracks and making big changes to the setlist in each location! Whether you come to one show or two or three, weâ€™ll make sure the live experience never gets boring!
https://youtu.be/SxzSYnV8d1w
What can you tell us about the evolution of nano.RIPE, both musically and as a duo, over the past two decades since you first started?
Although weâ€™ve gone through several member changes, Iâ€™m really glad weâ€™ve been able to keep going without stopping. When the members change, the sound naturally changes too, but thatâ€™s why weâ€™ve made a point of clearly deciding which parts should change and which should stay the same. By focusing on creating music that stays true to nano.RIPE, I feel weâ€™ve been able to grow.
Speaking of growth, how would you describe the new sound of Hikari wo Hakobumono and its theme of "initial impulses"?
This is the 15th year since our debut, and our eighth album, but we still have plenty we want to do and sing about. I think thatâ€™s because the â€œinitial impulseâ€ we had when we started the band is still with us. This album is packed with that feeling.
At Honey's Anime, we're thrilled about your new album, and many of your fresh tracks have been stuck in our heads since the first listen. Could you share a message with our readers who have been following your successful career?
Thank you so much for always supporting nano.RIPE! Weâ€™ll keep working hard to create great music. We look forward to the day we can meet at a live show.
We certainly be attending oneâ€”or moreâ€”of your shows this year! And if you're outside Japan but still love nano.RIPE, or you're just discovering them, be sure to check out their socials and follow them to stay updated on everything they're doing!

item.title: [Honey's Anime Interview] Rico Sasaki on Palette Days and Her Creative Journey
item.content:encoded:
With a growing list of anime credits and a voice that effortlessly bridges the worlds of music and performance, Rico Sasaki continues to leave her mark across Japanâ€™s entertainment scene. In this exclusive interview, she shares her excitement over performing â€œPalette Daysâ€, the opening theme for Welcome to Japan, Ms. Elf!, and dives into her unique process behind voicing the charming cat-boy Mewi. From heartfelt songwriting to her dreams of voicing unexpected roles, Rico Sasaki opens up about her passion, versatility, and the joy she finds in connecting with fans through both music and character.

Rico Sasaki
Honey-Chan
Interview with Rico Sasaki
[gray-hex-decoration]
Ms. Sasaki, thank you so much for taking the time to chat with us. Itâ€™s a real pleasure to learn more about one of our favorite artists! You've had several years of career and nearly a dozen appearances in anime. How are you feeling about your song "Palette Days" being chosen as the opening theme for the anime Welcome to Japan, Ms. Elf!?
When I heard I was chosen for the theme song, I was truly thrilled and honored! I was also happy when I passed the audition for the role of Mewi, and to be entrusted with the opening theme song as well! I almost jumped for joy.
And this isn't your only anime involvement this year. You recently performed as Doloris in the opening of BanG Dream! Ave Mujica and will also be voicing a character in the upcoming Isekai Mokushiroku Mynoghra. How do you personally relate to Welcome to Japan, Ms. Elf!? and what is the connection between your song "Palette Days" and this anime?
Every show has a completely different world, and getting to both act and sing in each one is truly fun and fulfilling! In Welcome to Japan, Ms. Elf!, I play Mewi, a cute cat-boy with the special ability to control magic stones. To fully bring out his charm, I read the original manga thoroughly, watched cat videos to study their meows, and practiced really hard!
https://youtu.be/CO3RPKGAUr8
While "Palette Days" was composed and arranged by KOUGA, with lyrics by Erica Masaki, another track on your latest single was written and composed by you. Could you tell us more about this particular song?
â€œKimi to Boku no Hoshiâ€ is a song about cherishing and never forgetting emotionsâ€”even loneliness and sadnessâ€”and turning those feelings into the strength to face tomorrow, with a firm resolve to become a star. Itâ€™s like a wish carried on a shooting star. To stir the listenerâ€™s imagination, I intentionally used vague expressions, kept the instrumentation simple, and went through many rounds of trial and error, repeatedly sharing my vision as we shaped the song.
You've had a notable career as a voice actress. How do you balance your time between your roles as a singer and an actress? What excites you the most about each?
Through singing, I can express my true, unfiltered emotions as Rico Sasaki. Through voice acting, I can become someone entirely different. Both are irreplaceable sources of purpose in my life, and getting to pursue something Iâ€™ve loved since I was young brings me more joy than anything else.
As an artist with such a distinctive voice, how do you prepare vocally for such varied projects like singing and voice acting? Do you have any special routines?
Eating well and getting plenty of sleep! No matter how motivated or excited I am, if Iâ€™m not healthy, I canâ€™t give 100%, and Iâ€™d definitely regret that. So before a performance, Iâ€™m extra careful about taking care of myself. I also read lots of messages from fans. Even when Iâ€™m feeling anxious, their words calm me and make me want to see everyone right away. It instantly blows my fatigue away!
And to wrap up the interview, is there any unexpected type of role you'd like to voice in the future, such as a ruthless villainess, a quirky mascot character, or something along those lines?
Iâ€™d love to try voicing a handsome young man! Iâ€™ve played young boys around elementary school age before, but Iâ€™ve never had the chance to voice a teenage or adult male character, so Iâ€™d really like to try it. Iâ€™ll study hard to deliver a cool performance that gets everyoneâ€™s hearts racing!
Thank you again, Ms. Sasaki, for sharing your time and insights with us. Weâ€™re excited to see what the future holds for youâ€”both on stage and on screenâ€”and weâ€™ll be cheering you on every step of the way!

  • Singer and voice actress Rico Sasaki will release her new single â€œMajestic Catastropheâ€ on August 27, 2025. The title track serves as the opening theme for the TV anime Apocalypse Bringer Mynoghra: World Conquest Starts with the Civilization of Ruin, which premieres in July 2025.
  • Apocalypse Bringer Mynoghra is a nation-building fantasy series that follows Takuto Ira, a legendary player who once topped the user rankings in Eternal Nations, a nation-management simulation game set in a fantasy world. While hospitalized, he loses consciousness and wakes up in Idragia, a world that feels just like the game. Thus begins a tale of fantasy and empire-building.
  • â€œMajestic Catastrophe,â€ the animeâ€™s opening theme, builds on Sasakiâ€™s signature rock sound while venturing into new territory with a symphonic metal style that reflects the animeâ€™s world. The powerful, dramatic track is matched by Sasakiâ€™s commanding vocals.
  • The single includes three songs: the title track â€œMajestic Catastropheâ€ and two additional tracks, one featuring lyrics written by Sasaki herself.

    • Comment from Rico Sasaki

    Iâ€™ll be performing â€œMajestic Catastrophe,â€ the opening theme for the TV anime Apocalypse Bringer Mynoghra: World Conquest Starts with the Civilization of Ruin! Itâ€™s a dark and beautiful song that brings a sense of catharsis. I sang powerfully to reflect its pressing intensity, and delicately, as if searching for hope in the darkness. The heavy chorus, along with lyrics and a melody that evoke an ominous atmosphere, all work together to draw listeners into the depths of a dark musical world. â€œMajestic Catastropheâ€ stirs emotions deep withinâ€”get ready to be hooked by its irresistible darkness.

  • BANDAI has launched a new IP, â€œLINK TRAVELERS,â€ built around two main distribution channels: â€œSIDE:C (CANDY = Shokugan)â€ and â€œSIDE:G (GASHAPON = Capsule Toys).â€ Angelina 1/3 of Gacharic Spin, also often referred to as â€œReiwa eraâ€™s Radio Star,â€ performs the theme song for the first promotional video, now streaming on major music platforms!
  • Following the major success of the original capsule toy figure series â€œGashapon Quest,â€ LINK TRAVELERS, first revealed in November 2024, is a new project that expands into both the Shokugan and Gashapon markets. The series drew strong anticipation from the moment online pre-orders began, and is officially set to release in May 2025. With highly detailed figures and customizable parts, the new line offers users the freedom to play and create based on their own preferences, while its rich backstory and well-developed world setting will add further depth to the imaginative experience.

Sawa, the project lead for LINK TRAVELERS at Bandai, have been released. We invite you to experience a wide array of content, including Shokugan, Gashapon, video, and music!

It means so much to me to be part of this powerful project, especially with the incredible Eijun-san, whose work I deeply admire. The songs Eijun-san writes always give me the strength to move forward and take me to new places.     â€œFrom the opening to the powerful chorus, this song does a fantastic job of fully expressing the world of the first installment of LINK TRAVELERS. item.title: [Honey's Anime Interview] STEREO DIVE FOUNDATIONâ€™s RON Reflects on 10 Years of Hits and Musical Evolution
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url=" ]

Celebrating a decade of genre-blending innovation and emotional resonance, STEREO DIVE FOUNDATIONâ€”helmed by the multi-talented artist and producer RONâ€”marks its 10th anniversary with the release of "STEREO DIVE 03." In this interview, RON reflects on his evolution as a creator, the balance between artistic vision and collaboration, and the deeply personal threads woven through his latest work.

RON
Honey-Chan
Interview with RON from STEREO DIVE FOUNDATION
[gray-hex-decoration]
RON, thank you very much for this opportunity! It's great to have you back, and congratulations on the 10th anniversary of STEREO DIVE FOUNDATION! Looking back on the past decade, how has your sound evolved since the release of your debut track â€œDaisyâ€?
Over the past decade, Iâ€™ve written many songs, not only for myself but also as a music producer for others. Through my various experiences as a musician, I feel that the process of translating musical ideas in my head into concrete output has become more refined. I also sense that my creative repertoire has significantly expanded.
Your new album 'STEREO DIVE 03' features a mix of tie-up songs with anime, as well as original tracks. How do you balance the demands of working on anime theme songs with your personal musical vision?
I primarily approach my work in a way that aligns with the anime. From my creative repertoire, I carefully select the musical elements that best suit the series. For parts beyond the first verse that arenâ€™t used in the anime, I sometimes take a more personal approach.
Youâ€™ve mentioned that the song '#03', which opens the album, represents your feelings of â€œlooking forward to the future.â€ Can you explain more about the meaning behind the track and how it ties into your current journey as an artist?
To mark the 10th anniversary, I wanted to include a special touch. By bringing the intro phrase of â€œDaisyâ€ to the very end, I aimed to express respect for the beginning while also conveying a sense of appreciation for whatâ€™s to come.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=haQ1-nHFE1I
Given that youâ€™ve worked in many different contexts throughout these years, how have these experiences shaped your musical style and the way you connect with your audience? And how is that reflected in 'STEREO DIVE 03'?
In recent years, Iâ€™ve had more opportunities to perform in front of overseas audiences. The song â€œHIKARI,â€ which is included in the album, was created specifically as a piece that could be sung together with them. When I performed it live, I truly felt a sense of unity, which was an awesome experience.
Your work as a composer spans multiple genres, from rock to EDM to orchestral arrangements. How do you decide which genre best fits the emotional tone of a song, especially when itâ€™s tied to an anime series?
I generally strive to write music in line with the request. When given full creative freedom, I refer to the script, storyboard, or any available footage to determine the appropriate genre and instruments for the scene.
Do you have any favorite anisong from your own repertory? If so, which one and why?
Itâ€™s hard to choose just one, but if I had to, Iâ€™d say â€œSTORYSEEKER.â€ I love both the melody and the arrangement. I put a lot of effort into it, even using custom sampling data that I created myself.
With the 10th anniversary of STEREO DIVE FOUNDATION, what new goals and aspirations do you have for the future of your music and creative journey?
I want to reflect and think about what I truly want to create. I also aim to refine the balance between my own creative desires and external requests while deepening my mindset for pursuing what I love.
Weâ€™re sure many Honeyâ€™s Anime readers have followed your journey, some from the very beginning. Is there anything youâ€™d like to say to them as we wrap up the interview?
I want to express my gratitude to those who discovered SDF or RON through anime. Iâ€™ll continue creating many more songs, so please look forward to them!

Final Thoughts

With ten years of boundary-pushing music behind him, RON shows no signs of slowing down. As STEREO DIVE FOUNDATION enters its next phase, his commitment to authenticity, growth, and emotional connection remains unwavering. Whether through anime tie-ins or deeply personal tracks, RON continues to craft music that resonates across cultures and generationsâ€”inviting listeners to dive even deeper into the soundscapes he so passionately creates. As STEREO DIVE FOUNDATION looks ahead to a new chapter, we also look forward to many more songs from this amazing band. We've been here to appreciate these 10 years of music, and we'll continue to do so in the next decade too!

item.title: MyAnimeListâ€™s â€œYou Should Read This Mangaâ€ Final Lineup Revealed!
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • MyAnimeList has unveiled the official list for the third annual â€œYou Should Read This Manga 2025,â€ a global event designed to highlight exceptional new-and-upcoming manga available to the international fan. The final list, curated from 766 user nominated titles, features 77 unique manga series across four discovery categories.
  • This highly-anticipated event aims to spotlight recently published manga and connect fans worldwide with new stories that deserve more recognition on a global scale. For 2025, the project continues to serve as a cultural bridge between creators, publishers, and readers in over 240 countries and territories.
  • As an added incentive, MyAnimeList users who read 2 volumes of any title from the 2025 list during the campaign period will earn a time-limited profile badge.

    • About â€œYou Should Read This Manga 2025â€?

    A unique global manga promotion project carried out by world-renowned anime and manga community MyAnimeList in conjunction with industry professionals. The project is the first of its kind, using online nominations from users around the world to produce the ultimate list of manga recommendations for that year. Aside from the main category, â€œYou Should Read This Manga,â€ the project includes a number of sub-categories, including series that fans would like to see animated.

    Categories & Criteria

    This global manga discovery project was launched with the goal of inspiring fans around the world to explore lesser-known but highly recommended titles. The final list is created from user-submitted nominations, which allows fans to vote for up to 10 titles and include persuasive reasoning for why each title should be featured. Titles must have seen an overseas release in 2024, and have a Score and Popularity ranking below #50 on MyAnimeList to be eligible for nomination. The 2025 edition includes four curated categories: You Should read This Manga 2025 For manga that readers simply really want to recommend to a friend! (e.g. Gachiakuta, Magus of the Library, Kagurabachi) Should Be Anime For manga not adapted into anime within the past 5 years. (e.g. Gokurakugai, Kindergarten Wars, Firefly Wedding) Best for Beginners For new readers; short, accessible, or recently adapted into anime. (e.g. Dandadan, Smoking Behind the Supermarket with You, RuriDragon) Unique Art/Story For seasoned manga fans seeking originality in artwork or narrative. (e.g. Veil, Kaiju Girl Caramelise, The Color of the End: Mission in the Apocalypse) Explore the full list of selected works here: mxj.myanimelist.net/readthismanga/2025/nomination

    Trends from This Yearâ€™s List

    Demographic Balance: Half of the selected titles were originally published in shounen or seinen magazines. Notably, one in four of these titles received more votes from female readers. Digital Origins: 25% of the titles come from web-based manga platforms such as Shonen Jump+ or Manga UP. Anime Demand: Over half the â€œShould Be Animeâ€ picks are shounen, with two-thirds of these available for free via MANGA Plus. Female Reader Influence: The â€œUnique Art/Storyâ€ list saw the majority of votes come from female users, in contrast to the other lists. Breakout Titles: Girls love/yuri manga The Guy She Was Interested in Wasn't a Guy at All had total nominations almost equal to all GL titles combined from the previous year. Likewise, new nominations for action manga Kagurabachi doubled any other action title.

    Additional Content

    The project also features bonus recommendation sections created in collaboration with manga publishers and booksellers: Try This Manga â€” for Free! â†’ mxj.myanimelist.net/readthismanga/2025/try-manga Publisher & Bookseller Picks â†’ mxj.myanimelist.net/readthismanga/2025/more-recs Kodansha Critical Hits & Fan-Favorites â†’ mxj.myanimelist.net/readthismanga/2025/kodansha

    About MyAnimeList

    MyAnimeList is an anime and manga community, with comprehensive databases maintained by its passionate user base. The website allows members to track their viewing progress, rate and discuss titles, write reviews, and discover new works through various community-driven features. With over 19.5 million users from more than 240 different countries and territories, MyAnimeList is an essential resource for the international anime and manga fan. *Figures as of March 2025. For more about MyAnimeList, please visit myanimelist.net. For more information or press inquiries, please contact: sales@mail.myanimelist.net.

  • It was recently announced that the ending theme song for upcoming anime Aru Majo ga Shinu Made, airing April 1, will be sung by Aoi Teshima. The song â€œHana Saku Michi deâ€ was written and arranged by songwriter Yuki Kajiura.
  • You can listen and watch the newest music video for the anime that was released today featuring a short version of the song.
  • Aru Majo ga Shinu Made is a heartwarming fantasy about Meg, a 17-year-old apprentice witch, who is told by her long-lived teacher, Faust, that a terrible curse has left her with only one year to live. In order to break the curse, Meg sets out to bring happiness to those around her and collect the joyful tears shed by 1,000 people within a year.
  • The ending theme song â€œHana Saku Michi deâ€ was produced by songwriter and composer Yuki Kajiura, who has gained a huge following around the world thanks to her work on the soundtracks for many popular anime. This song is a collaboration between two artists leading at the forefront of their respective genres.
    • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=raGGkWkCAPY

    A Message from Aoi Teshima:

    I had the pleasure of singing the ending theme song for Aru Majo ga Shinu Made, â€œHana Saku Michi de.â€ This was my first time singing something written by Yuki Kajiura. The words and melody felt nostalgic somehow and I was able to really put my heart into it. It would make me happy if you all enjoyed the anime all the way to the ending theme as well.
    [sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

    Aoi Teshima Profile

    Aoi Teshima was born in 1987 from Fukuoka Prefecture. Following the release of her demo CD The Rose, she made her debut with "Therru's Song" featured in the 2006 Ghibli film Tales from Earthsea. In 2011, she sang the theme song for the film From Up on Poppy Hill. Preceding her debut, she released four highly-acclaimed film music cover albums and an original concept album. Through her music, Aoi Teshima continues to convey a worldview that only she can express. In celebration of the 15th anniversary of her debut, she released her first best-hit album Simple is best in 2021, and held a commemorative concert of the same title across Japan. On February 22 of the same year, she released her first live album LIVE 2022 "Simple is best" containing footage from the concert. Her exceptional voice has been in high demand for numerous theme songs and commercials thanks to her ability to move the hearts of her listeners with her songs, and her acclaim has been growing both at home and abroad.
    [sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

    Yuki Kajiura Profile

    A multi-talented music composer, producer and songwriter. She made her debut in 1993 as the composer and keyboardist for See-Saw. In 2002, her song â€œAnna ni Issho Datta no niâ€ became a hit as the ending theme for Mobile Suit Gundam SEED. She has since gone on to produce musical groups and continues to produce anime theme songs and soundtracks. In 2020, her work on the theme song for Demon Slayer: Mugen Train, â€œHomura,â€ alongside the singer LiSA, resulted in the track winning the 62nd Japan Record Awards. Sheâ€™s also composed music for Japanese films and television programs. In 2023, she released PARADE, her first album in nine years under her personal label FictionJunction. In December of the same year, she held her first two-day concert, â€œKaji Fes.2023,â€ as part of her global tour Yuki Kajiura LIVE.

  • It was recently announced that Maaya Sakamotoâ€™s latest song, â€œDrops,â€ will serve as the opening theme for the upcoming TV anime Aru Majo ga Shinu Made, which begins airing on April 1.   • The Limited First Edition comes with the Maaya Sakamoto 30th Anniversary Acrylic Stand, â€œOmote mo Ura mo Sakamoto Maaya!â€ (Maaya Sakamoto on the front and back!). In 2013, she released Singer-Songwriter, the first album for which she wrote all the music. In 2019, she released her 30th single â€œUchuu no Kiokuâ€ (produced by Ringo Sheena) and her 10th original album Kyou Dake no Ongaku. In 2020, she released her 25th anniversary album Single Collection+ Achikochi and the digital single â€œYakudo,â€ which topped the Oricon chart.
